Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Al-Buqaa'.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O son, I give you this book, which is the last part of medical science, to complete it as far as possible through its explanations and statements; to me, it seems that I have fulfilled this by writing this treatise, which begins with surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For as surgery is laid down in our country and in our time entirely deprived, so great danger lies in the science of it, and its evidence remains; except that there are a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which they changed with mistakes and situations until their judgments were closed, and the force of them was extended and their art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I see that I have made it possible to arrange this treatise in the second way of explanation and statement and abbreviation; and because it comes to add to the forms of the instruments of cauterization and other tools of work by addition of the statement, and for preparation of it, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The cause for which no good artisan can master himself in this art in our time, is that the science of medicine is long, and that he has to deal with the actor before him having been exercised in the science of anatomy which brings together Gualia as it knows the joints of the limbs and their shapes, and the connection and separation of them; and has knowledge of the bones, nerves, and ligaments, and their numbers, and the length of them; and of the pulsating veins and quiet veins, and the locations of their sensations.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And therefore say I that a certain name is necessary, small in the work, and more so in the art of surgery.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said of that in the introduction of this book; for who does not know that we told him about anatomy, is not aware that he falls into error by which people die, so I have seen many of them formed in this science and get themselves out of that science and their experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a doctor in a book and tried to find out that he had put an abscess of scrofula on the neck of a woman, and hit some of the arteries of the neck so that blood flowed from her; that's why she died among them.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who promised that he would cure an illness of a man which had progressed much, and the sickness was great, and he came to him and cut off part of the bladder with a bit of the urine, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	But I already called to remove that one out, and I saw that because of the greatness of the sickness and the disposition of the patient, it seemed certain that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who took a fee of two ducats from our land for surgery; and he had placed a black cast on him which was broken in the crotch of him; and the doctor prepared himself with his ignorance, he removed the fracture by cutting it, about the pubis, with pulvines and needles to strengthen the stretch; and did not leave the pubic area breathing.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	Then he removed the plaster according to his desires and prayer, and he left it for several days and commanded us to remove the ligament; and thus, in the end, the crotch was opened with an abscess, and came to destruction.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I dressed the ligament so that it was quiet and gave no more pain of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But corruption had already become established in the member, so I could not restrain that one, and I did not stop walking the corruption in the member until the patient was in danger.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who pierced an abscess of cancer and it became an ulcer in a few days, so that the evil of it reached its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	For the cause is that the cold cautery is pure of melancholic humors; therefore it does not seem to reach him by all means, but that he should be on a member which you suffer all to be host.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, son, it is necessary to you that the operation on man should be divided into two operations; one in which health is associated with work, and the other in which danger lies in the greatest dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already kept it here in all places of this book in which work is done by mistake and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to keep it and not open it, so that the pages do not block your way to speak or disturb you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Then take your weapons with care and protection of God, and your illnesses with relief and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	Then take your best way through the grace of God for salvation and worthy succession, and leave those terrible illnesses of difficult recovery, and keep your weapons from here which makes you afraid, so that it does not escape you in your faith and in your name: for more remains to your glory, and first and last before your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gualia has said in some of his advice:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Do not cure a bad disease so that you do not have to deal with bad doctors."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered by head, in the shapes of instruments and tools of cauterization, and from that which is necessary for surgery.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of cutting and piercing, and of vacuums, and of extractions of arrows and resembling those, is divided and ordered by the shapes of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, of restoration and dislocation, and of cure of torsion and resembling those; chapter ordered by head, in the shapes of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of fire cauterization and acute medicine and remembrance of surgery.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of all the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I will tell you the quality of the joints of cauterization and the important points of it, and in which combination it should be prohibited to make cauterization.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the speech of the quality of the joint of cauterization and the important points of it is long and prolix, and subtle by science, and hidden; and from him a great many of knowledge, and from him they disagree, and for me a little of their speeches is enough for understanding.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	Therefore I say that cauterization confers on all combinations universally the same quality; except for two combinations which are combinations of five parts.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the combination of tail and dry matter it will disagree; for some say that cauterization is favorable to that one, and others say the opposite that cauterization is not suitable in a disease of quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is not suitable that a disease of tail and dry matter be healed by the same which is dry and hot.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	He who says the opposite of that one, is it not favorable in all disease of tail and dry matter which he sees in men's bodies; because when you compare men's bodies with the dryness of him to the combination of fire, he frightens his own body.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the word of that man, who experienced this already a few times to uncover it.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But nevertheless I do not cover that it comes upon this one which is already exhausted and exercised in the chapter of cauterization per latter exercise, and has known the diversity of the complexions of men and the causes of those, and the accidents of their own, and the space of the time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	Mays in the other complexions, it is not upon you a fear, and mostly in the wet and damp diseases, since all doctors are agreed about them, and they are not discordant in the cauterization of those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And you know, children, that of the secret of cure per cautery by fire and of the goodness of it, it is because the fire is simple, the action of which does not reach but to the member which is cauterized and not to another member with the medicine applied, since it is only a small injury.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of the burning medicine reaches that member which it is applied to, and strongly brings about a healing in the sickly member, and strongly it has a taste.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But the fire, for its subtlety and its substance goodness, does not affect it but that it overflows And I have already known it by experience and by long service in studying the truth of causes; and through this one I am excused from the length of speech And if it were not that it is not legible to me at my own will in this pause to you hidden with fire, and the quality of the operation of it on the bodies and of its excretion by which it eliminates the diseases, with philosophical demonstrative speech, which would serve acutely in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And you know, children, that they disagree about the time in which it is convenient to make cauterization and pause the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterization is convenient at all times, so that the injury by time is submerged in the healing of it that is drawn out by cauterization, and mostly if the cauterization is for pains or necessary pains, which do not suffer a delay since they are feared from those which come out by time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And then do not cast in your minds, or children, that this is only the popular belief and foolish practices; since it is because all disease which is healed by cauterization is not suitable at all times, and pause at that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not good in that way which they watch by it, since cauterization is only a place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries up the humidities which are the causes from which pains come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But nevertheless cauterization in excess over the medicine by the will of its usefulness and the virtue of its operation and greatness of its Lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the disease which was administered to it by medicine returns in some hour of time, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of his disease, and the virtue of it; and because it was prepared in its body with the addition of its excesses to its food and the resemblance to those causes; but if the disease which was healed by this is subtle in a member of few excesses and humidities, then, if that medicine for a tooth pain is similar to it, it is possible that in him it does not return that pain, but that it goes away.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	But popular speech is that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a harsh speech, not to him who understands it, since I believe that it is no cure which profited by medicine or any other cause; but cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to this; and I say that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine only when we administer the methods of cure in some diseases, and those medicines do not benefit, and at the end of the cause we administer medicine to him, and it benefits at that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And then from here I say that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding which I have of the popular beliefs and silly practices of doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they say that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron, and do not say this one but for the equality of gold and its subtlety.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they say that the place of cauterization does not burn, since I have already seen it and touched it that this one does not burn except in some courses where the others do; and cauterization with iron is good and better than that with gold as they say; but when you make cauterization with fire of gold, it is not revealed to you, because it depends on the quantity which you want for the roughness of gold, and because it prepares to receive it in the fire; and if you place over it ignitions so that gold burns by the fire, and perhaps in the fire some sheets by which the artisan cuts himself through its occupation.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this one is made cauterization with iron, it must be done lightly and carefully on the right side of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on cauterization according to the other chapters, and I have ordered those within the chapters so that they answer your questions which you want about them.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	About cauterization for a headache by cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers on humidity and cold the accident of which there are two causes; so it is a cause of soda and many fluxes of rheumatic fever, called rhagousia, from the head to the branches of the neck and ears flowing, and many sleeping, and toothache and gingivitis, and generally in all diseases that come by cold; so also, for those which are paralyzed, and sudorously and apoplexially.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is that, first of all, you command the patient to be evacuated by lacative medicine from his head, for three or four nights, according to whether you require the virtue of the disease and its age and custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then order him to shave his head with a razor, and then make him sit between your legs on a bench that is raised, and place his hands over the area.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then pause the movement of your palm on top of the movements of the razor on his nose between his ears.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But nevertheless, when this one says about the place of your head, it is reached, and then take the olive oil with your hand on that place; and then ignite cauterization in its middle.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then pause it on the place gently, so that it goes down slowly, and your hand is put into constraint little by little, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then raise your hand slightly and look at the place, and if you see some quantity of hair fall off, like the amount of salt in water, then lower your hand, and if it does not turn to iron, then move it from that one, if it is cold, before you see the bone which I have told you about.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it on that place and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then pause over it wrapped in a bandage and leave it under it until the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that place with a fourfold medicinal ointment so that it be healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they say that when the Roman plague raged, so many were burned with fire; because it was better and more pleasant.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they say some of their that is cauterized within the bone, and it should be heated to dry up a part of its surface.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And be it cut off that which is close to the bone, and be it healed.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And they said to me that the cautery should go up to the last, until it reaches the strong bone, and this is the form of the little alpaca:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they say from that place exhale the vapors of the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the blister should be kept open for a long time, and be it healed before it hardens.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I do not see these two kinds of cauterizing at all, except in the case of a great fear; and let this one be better if it is healed, since the head is destroyed by solution of continuity from it, as we have shown in the other members, and especially when the patient's head is of freckle nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first kind of cauterizing is better saved and more useful to me; and of that one, and of that work, I am a supporter.
Capitol segon.	Capitolo secondo.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the head cauterizing.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in the whole head chronic and long pain occurs, and water remains in the patient's head for a long time, and he uses plasters and poultices and salves and ointments and ointments and oils and perfumes, and especially if he has already been cauterized with one type of cauterizing and does not profit from another, consider that if the head of the patient is of strong creation in its nature; and it is not pleasant and causes much pain, then cauterize it with another cauterizing.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize that on the tip of his head with a cauterizing, so that the knot is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the knot and expose the bone as much as we have said, and cauterize that in the last part of the head behind the ear - and it is that place where wind is let out.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And rejoice your hand in it, and do not expose the bone, for the patient' water causes great pain, different from the pain of all the other head cauterizing.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And direct this cauterizing to its place, for what is more subtle cauterizing of the head's horns and the occiput than that cauterizing with which it is cauterized in the back of the head; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Capitolo terzo.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the cauterization of an old emigrant.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When in the back of the head hard pain occurs, or it hurts within the ear, have the head cleansed with medicine, and administered another cure, which I have mentioned in the causes of the head' water; and does not profit from it, then cauterize it twice: either with acuter medication that burns, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But cauterizing with acuter medication that burns is to take a piece of lead, and burn it, and rub the edges of both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then cut the place of pain in the temple with a sharp knife, so that it is within it, so that the knot is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then hold it with a stopwatch by constant contraction, and leave it for three hours; then take off the lead, and keep the blister for two or three days, and put your hand on it submerged in water until the place is pain-free.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then heal that with ointment so that it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, there are some medicines with which I have written in the two treatises of burning medicine.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But the cauterizing with iron according to this method: this is its form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	is called a little peg, because the head is thus shaped in its form as a peg has some curvature, and it is at its midpoint that there is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then put your hand on the place of pain and hold it firmly  - so that the peg is not broken - and turn the small iron slowly.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of it that is dried up by the knot is about half of it, and raise your hand so that the artery is not broken, so that blood does not flow from it.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then dip the cloth in salt water and put it on the place, and leave it for three days; then dip the cloth slightly under the edge, and heal that with ointment so that it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see it, cauterize the end of the knife according to cauterizing, and beware of cutting the artery in this old emigrant properly.
Capitol quart.	Capitolo quarto.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cauterization of an old emigrant.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an old emigrant with water that I have mentioned in the previous cure, and which is not profitable for the emigrant' water, and sometimes because of the cause of the head' water which I have mentioned in the causes of the head' water, and does not profit from it, and sometimes because of the cause of the head' water that I have mentioned according to cauterizing with a knife, so that it is white, since it indicates on the place of pain with a long line that is half of it; and leave your hand for a turn, and firmly hold it within incision of the artery and turn the knife within it, so that the iron goes into it.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to protect the continuity of the jaw which is tightly bound by mastication, and that the larynx is not broken, and the nerves are not damaged, and do not get entangled by a spasm.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the care and safety of the flow of blood from the artery that is cut off, since in the cutting off of it there is danger, and mostly at the one which does not know water and is not studious and is impatient; and leave the operation on it at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I come to mind with the memory of the accident of blood flow of the artery according to your method, in its place from this free.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	If this old head does not profit from this cauterizing and the patient' neck is tolerable, then cauterize that in the middle of the head according to what we have said, and heal the blister so that it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cauterizing that I have mentioned in the chapter of stretching the artery by two knives, and it is better cauterization than this, and confirm more.
Capitol .v.	Capitolo quinto.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of the cauterization of ear pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain from scratching and it is treated with the causes of the scratch cure and with the other cure that I have mentioned in the division, and if the pain does not improve, then burn the cauterizing, and this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then burn the end of the knife towards its ignition, and direct it around the whole ear as a rolling wheel or in the circuit of any small part if the pain is there.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Along with the cauterizing of the hair of the ear, slowly but surely so as not to burn the place with the tip.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cauterizing of punctures is spread over the whole ear, and then it, and heal the places so that they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Capitolo sesto.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of the cauterization of a tumor.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	A tumor that is cured and the cauterization is not anything other than the medicines that enter through the blood according to what we have mentioned in the causes of the head' water.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization by the heat of the instrument, which endangers the person through drying out or spasm of the nerves.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that kind of torture with ablation and purgation and enema, and don't control your treatment, then when you cauterize the anus with three things: first, razing the anus, second, a small piece of hot iron, third, the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And pause the small cauterization for the opposite of the bad part, because softening doesn't happen except in the part that is healing and becoming healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cauterization is that you cauterize that with the cauterizer on the right side of the edge of the anus, placing a small piece above the hairline of the head, and in the hot one, whose length should be according to the length of the said leg, and then pause your hand on it cauterized so that the amount of the essence of the wound is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the form of the cauterization, and it is special with the knife, the shape of which is facing forward.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But more importantly, that little one slowly pours out; and when it comes to the knife in place of unnecessary excess richness a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with water that is already cooked in front of it so that it heals.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter .vii.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On Cauterization for Ancient Apoplexies
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When an ancient apoplexy is and you treat it with water that we have said and don't give your medicine and the person doesn't have a fever, then cauterize that with four things: over all the hairs of his head; and at the cauterizer and the top of his head, as we have said; and at the skull.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the way of the cauterization is done according to what has been said.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it is already cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and more later; and then, treat it with water that you have cooked.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter .viii.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On Cauterization for Oblivion Caused by Flame
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Then give the patient in the beginning great jerras and pills with a servant telling them.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then return the head of the patient to the barber who is in charge, and place him on his back with a black cloth described in the treatise about plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	Then pause some drops, because that is a way of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And make it according to the water measure that I have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And then if it is good for the person's health; and otherwise, then do three things on the back part of his head, which are placed from the back edge of the head to the front edge within the hairline.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And pause between each cauterization the length of the leg, and then treat the cauterized area with water that has been cooked.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you add more and the person tolerates water, then treat the cauterization in the middle; and if you add less, then cauterize that above the two hairlines.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat that within which is healing; and it is the olive cauterization according to the shape that has been given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter .ix.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On Cauterization for Paralysis and Softening of the Whole Body
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Then treat the person's head in ablation with jerras and water that we have said; then return the head of the patient to the barber, and cauterize that in the middle part of the head, and over all the hairlines, and over the back part of the neck, and over the two spondylos of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary for the softening of the whole body, then treat that with the four things mentioned above; and more importantly, treat it so that the essence of the wound is burned out of the body, and support your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then treat that area within which is healing, and let that be olive cauterization.
Capitol .x.	Chapter .x.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On Cauterization for Epilepsy
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epilepsy is not cauterized, but that kind of epilepsy is caused by flame.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Then treat the person' brain at the beginning with jerras and another treatment that we have mentioned in the chapter when the patient has a great illness and tolerates the medicine' effects.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who doesn't tolerate the medicine, then administer ablation and enema to him in front of water for three days, with a servant telling them; and with good food for the child.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then return the head of the patient to the barber, and then cauterize that with one thing in the middle part of the head according to the previous way, and another one on the occiput of the head, and over each hairline, so that his hairlines are also cauterized.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the person is strong and tolerant, then cauterize that with the things mentioned above, in paralactic position and softening of the whole body over the spondylos of the neck and back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	Then do olive cauterization according to what has been said before.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then pause in a subtle way according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On Cauterization for Melancholy
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted moistures and coarse flame, then cauterize that with the things that we have said in the case of paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excess of sadness causing melancholy, and the patient' body is moist, then give him water that treats his brain according to what has been mentioned in the previous chapter.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then return the head of the patient to the barber, and then make it turn gently over its hairline, and then pause it in the middle part of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the person be sixty years old, and is held by his hand throughout.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then pause the oiling; and it is more worthy of being a shepherd than an ox.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And dry that over fire with moderate heat that he endures when it is hot in his mouth.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then hold him in the middle part of his head in the circle, and let him wait until he is chilled.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And treat the person with water once a week, either with one treatment or with cauterization mentioned above, in order to moisten his brain and equalize it.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then pause that hair in the shade or in gray-colored hair.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On Cauterization for Downward Water in the Stomach
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have said that the beginning of water in the stomach is declared by the signs mentioned in the previous chapter, then start and give the person water that treats his head, and hold back all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	Then do the sugaring in baths with cold water for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then order the person to wash his hair, and cauterize that with one thing in the middle part of the head; and then cauterize that with two things over two temples, or from the beginning of the water in two vessels, or at the beginning of the water in a single vessel.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Then apply one thing to all the veins and arteries that are left of the head; and those things are applied at a distance in the length of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And don''t give him any medicine when he is cauterized; and if you have to give him any medicine, which is unlikely, then do so with great caution.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I come to wisdom who is in extract of herbs and in abstinence from those and caution from flows of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some are cauterized in the neck between two bones, two cauterized tools being removed.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter .XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cauterization of ancient tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears of grief are ancient and flow vigorously through the veins and arteries that go to the top of the head and it is shown that this is a superfluity of fluid phlegm, then cauterize it with a cautery as we have described in the beginning of this book on water coming out of the eyes, and cauterize it in the middle of the head and two cauterizes between two temples, and two cauterizes between two bones of the neck.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if there is swelling, then cauterize it in all places on the edge of the eyelid over the brow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter .XII.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of a bad smell from the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you prepare and give to the patient three glasses of wine; then shampoo his hair, and cauterize it with a cautery that is half strong and half mild.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize it with a clavium cautery, two cauterizes on the two eyebrows, one small hair being left between them.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And keep away from fire so that you do not burn it up.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And of this cauterization with the clavium, this is the method.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the cauterization of eyelids of eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or moisture, then cauterize it with a cautery that has this shape.
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, then cauterize it above the two eyebrows a little, and let them be long in length.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	Let the length of each cautery be according to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not squeeze your hand too much with the cauterizer, less according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is dried up.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the cauterization of eyelids of eyes when the hairs are turned inward and the hand pulls the eyelid.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eyelid are turned inward so that they can be pulled out with a pinch, then cauterize it in two ways, because cauterization or medicine burning is done.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If a cauterization of fire is to be done, then the servant in front should not wet his hair, but rather let it be long and curled; and if he pulls it out, then you should strengthen the eyelids with a cloth so that they are not torn, and let them be pulled out.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then, when they are curled and curled up, then pause the servant's head on a stone, and place his hand over the eyelids of his hair with a clenched fist, according to the figure of a fawn in death; and this is the beginning of the sign.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then pause the sign in beggar's milk in an album or peacock's feathers on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then set fire to the cauterizer, and this is the shape of it:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize on the shape that is signified, little by little, until the surface of the eye is burned and it looks like a leaf of mint, completely burnt.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And this is the sign of health from this work, that you see the eyelid of the eye already tightened and the hairs of the eyebrow already curled up by the pinches of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and let it rest on the sign for three days, and then pause over it on a stone, and let fire be applied to it until it is burned up completely.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then cure that with oil, so that it heals.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if for some reason the hair falls out and the eyelid is softened, then do the cauterization again all at once with a strong fire.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hair is in the eyelid below, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural place and curled up, so that the hairs do not pinch the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But if the cauterization is with burning medicine, then order the servant to wet his hair so that it is long and curled up, and then let him be burned with a strong fire in the shape of a peacock' s feathers.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	Then dip it in salt water and in live garlic. Chapter I. Take this water, and mix it with both of these ingredients, and make it into a soup so that it does not become cold; and then pour it over the cloth that is done as a shape of a peacock' s feathers, and let it rest on one side; and let the head of the servant be on the other side; and dip that in salt water and in garlic, and then bring it to a boil so that it does not become cold, and then pour it over the cloth, and then dip the cloth in milk and butter, and let it rest on the table for an hour.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Then dip it in the medicine and let a little bit of it be on the tip, and then let the servant feel the bitterness of the medicine, because the bitterness is in fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Then, when the servant feels the bitterness of the medicine, then let him spit it out and wash his mouth with water; and then consider whether the eyelid has been raised as it should be raised with fire or with a cut, because he will feel well; and if not, then return to the medicine on the spot where the medicine has not been applied and the operation has not been completed, and has not been damaged.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then pause the sign on a stone, and let it be burned until it is completely eradicated, and then cure it with oil or something else that heals.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And you must be vigilant in your operation so that the medicine does not fall on the eyelid, and if the eyebrow is softened by a cause of the hair pinching the eye, then repeat your medicine to the spot where the eyelid is softened, and completely do it, and then return to the place where it should be healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the shape of a peacock' s feathers.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	Know that the eyelids of men are different in size and shape, and therefore your contraction should be according to this.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not hide the way to make it for yourself if you want to study this craft.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula in the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with the water that we have described in the divisions of the face, and do not confer your treatment, then cover it so that you cauterize it according to this method: order the servant to place his head on a stone, and let him hold his hair back with a cloth in such a way that he does not move or shake his head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then pause the sign in beggar' s milk in an album or peacock' s feathers on the eye of the servant.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then set fire to the cauterizer, and this is the shape:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	that is curved like a cane or a feather of a bird, from one end which is done with the cauterizer.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see it, then it should pierce to the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want to come out so try.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But however that is enclosed is better to the whole work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And approach the fistula if it is open, and take out of it and dries up that.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and remove the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And place over it the cautery which is well ignited, and touch that the patient's hand or the hernia slightly at the tip of the nose, so that your hand or the hernia does not disturb, and then place the cautery on the veins of the foot, and corrupt that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of the cauterization pain entered into the bone, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cauterization a time or two, if necessary, and leave that there for three days, and place over it with care and wet it with salt water until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if it is not healed after eleven days, then place over it the sharp corrosive medicine again, so that the bone is exposed and scrape it according to what you want in his chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another way of cauterizing a fistula that they first said: go to the place of the fistula and pour it out and place in that crack thin as a blade which is the shape of it: And pour into it a quarter of a pound of molten lead; and if your hand is firm, and does not hurt the patient for the lead to reach the foot of the nose, then cover that with a cloth wetted with milk or water, because the lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it by a wonderful cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with water that we have spoken of in the cauterization and cure, it is good; but if not, then it is necessary to administer a nose troch of the nose and reduce the fistula to the base of the nose according to what comes into its own place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the Cauterization of the fracture of the bones.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Veiled warts may come about in the lips, and more often in children's lips.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	So if you cure those cracks with the water that we have spoken in the divisions and do not profit from your cure, then ignite the small cautery according to this shape that it encases:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And its cavity according to the subtlety of a blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that with great care in those cracks so that the cauterization reaches the tip of the cracks.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with care within that it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the Cauterization of a Fistula in the Mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And when in the root of the uvula or on the palate or on the roots of the teeth it gives rise to a swelling and then breaks, and then it becomes holed, and then it is corroded, and then there is made a fistula, and you cure that and do not profit from your cure, then place that which ignites the cauterization according to the quantity that is received in the fistula, and then place that ignited one on the tip of the fistula, and if it reaches the fire to the tip of the nose, and at the back of it make like this a time or two; and then cure that with water that we have spoken of in the cure, within that it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	But if the swelling is healed and it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to expose the place and scrape the bone according to what comes in his chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the Cauterization of the Teeth and the Softening of the Veins.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	And when the veins are softened by moisture and the teeth are loosened, then treat those with medicines and do not confer, then place the cap of the hernia in the patient' knee, and ignite the cauterization according to its shape that you put immediately over the tooth, and then insert into it the ignited cauterization quickly, and let your hand rest a little on that so that the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then take your hand off, and repeat the cauterization a few times according to what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then place the hernia in the patient' mouth a cup of salt water and hold that for an hour, and then drink that, because the loosened tooth is firm and the softened gum is tightened and the corrupted moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the Cauterization of Toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is by cold or there is a burning or biting sensation, and you do not profit from your cure with medicines, then cauterize that according to these two ways: or cauterize on the edge of the cow's udder, or cauterize by fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterizing on the Edge: It is that you take a cow' udder and press it on a pan of iron, and then place a cloth over the edge of it and wrap it around the end of the tooth, and then ignite that quickly on the tooth that it is heated, and let that rest on the patient' tooth immediately so that it is cooled.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat that cauterization a few times within that the virtue of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you see it, dip a cloth or a pad in the edge and place that on the tooth, and then place that ignited one on the edge within that it reaches the tip of the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But however the cauterization by fire is that you take a pad or a cloth of iron, and if it is not thin, and place it in the center of it a little thickness so that the heat of the fire does not reach the patient' mouth; for the fire to reach the tooth, then it must be thin.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cauterization according to its shape, and place that on the tooth, and if your hand is hot, then make a few times; because the pain may return or persist for some time.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And when by the power of that cauterization the hernia fills the patient' mouth with its edge and holds it for an hour, and this is the form of the cauterization:
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Cauterize by Edge: It is that you take any extreme end according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the tube:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the Cauterization of Extrophy.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrophy is of thick fluid and loose humors that do not submit to digestion by medicines and you see the digestion of those a little, then ignite the cauterization according to this shape, having two open ends so that the smoke reaches the other end, and place that ignited one on the swelling once, and another if you want from that, within that it reaches the tip of the swelling.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the swelling is little, then place the cauterization according to the quantity of the swelling, and let it rest for three days, and place over that a cloth wet with sweat within that it cools down.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with sweat and tries and bandages within that it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And this is the form of the tube or two cauterizations: to turn the patient' head, so as to place the tube in the correct position.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the Cauterization of Hoarsness of Voice and Constriction of Throat.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When the moisture comes to the patient' throat, and more often when water is generated by cold, then it is necessary to evacuate the hernia at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that according to this shape that it encases the vocal cord in its cavity.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And beware that you do not put the cauterizer on the nose or burn from the cord of him, but only a little bit.
