Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Some eye problems are treated with water that is milder than cauterization and cutting, because it is cured with sub-smoking in this way: Take chamomile, hyssop, marjoram, rugosa, sweet marjoram Arabic, camomile, bread, and similar herbs to those, and combine all of them or some of them in a bowl, and dip them in vinegar, and boil; then the bowl should be well stirred, and placed in its place on the table, with a hole above it, on which a sharp tool made of metal is set according to this method; make it from silver or from iron.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And the end should be inserted into the patient's mouth where the vapor can reach the uvula from above, so that the uvula becomes cloudy.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And repeat on those spots again until they are dry, and be careful not to apply this treatment at the beginning of an outbreak of blisters, because it would be too strong for them, and don't make water, but rather declare a blister from his cautery.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	Or if you don' have this instrument, then take a cane and put it on the end of it a closed pipe, so that the patient'a mouth is sealed, because the pipe of the water prevents the smoke from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	This treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter .xxxviii.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	Of extracting thorns and water that adheres to the foot, and of other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Spots on the foot or spines of paynes or any other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then take water that is apparent from it, and let the sight rest on it, because your tongue presses against the instrument in front of the sun, so that the water that is in the mouth is declared.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And water that does not appear to your eye in the foot, take it to make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, because it removes the attached cause of the blisters by vomiting; or have the patient drink a fishbone, or a raisin of lettuce, or a piece of dry bread; or hold a sponge of dry sea-leek tightly to his tongue, and then make the patient swallow it whole, for if you remove it to the place where thorns are attached and extract them, then they will be removed without pain.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	Or take a snake and hold it by the tail, and put it on a table and cut off its head; or take a pig and cut off its tail, and put it under the water.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	Or if you don' remove those causes that we have mentioned, then use an iron instrument according to this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it should be thinner than a thin thread, and in the end of it there should be a cavity that you insert into his mouth easily.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And keep his head raised up high, and be careful that the touch of his jaw to the neck does not cause him pain, so that it reaches his teeth or bone, or that he swallows it with the food.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But the patient who inserts it is worse, because his knowledge of the place of the attached cause and pulling his mouth toward the instrument, all according to the quantity that is prepared for him before it causes pain.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter .xxix.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of extracting blood blisters attached to the foot.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the blood is treated with water that we have mentioned in the division of medicine treatment and you don' agree, then consider on the foot of the patient under the sun, because your tongue has been pressed against the instrument that we have described to you.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Then if you want to remove the blood blister, extract it with a small knife or a delicate tool carefully.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to extract it in that way, then take a hollow tube and insert it into the foot of the patient, and place a hot iron in the cavity of the tube, and pour water as many times as the blood blister is dead and stops on the foot) throughout the day and let the patient drink water.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a bucket full of warm water, and work the mouth with it, and wash the mouth with it; and don't drink any food or water for an hour after that, because the blood blister will soon fall off if you feel the water.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	Or if it is not removed by water that we have mentioned, then sub-fume the patient with camphor or menthol using the instrument that we have described in the sub-fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Make water, and add a little wine to it.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	It is another way of operating by sub-fume, that you take a bowl filled with water and carbonized wood, and the bowl is covered with a blanket, and a hole is made in it, and the end of the instrument is inserted into that hole; then perform the sub-fumigation; and make the patient open his mouth on the end of the tube, and close his mouth so that the sub-fumigation does not cause pain to him until you know that the sub-fumigation has reached the blood blister, because the blood blister will soon fall off when it feels the sub-fumigation.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if not, then repeat the sub-fumigation many times, and prevent the patient from drinking, and eat salt foods and dry fruits, and don' drink water, and do what is necessary for him to be removed.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	This is the form of the instrument with which blood blisters are removed from the foot when seen; and it is similar to tweezers except that it has no curve.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed on the foot, and the end of it is similar to a pigeon's beak, which is sharp, but does not cut because when it presses any cause, it doesn't let go.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter.xl.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of surgery in the treatment of blisters and their incision.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Blisters are special spots, of different shapes, according to what they remind us of, each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in piercing and cutting them in two ways, the first of which is for the species of blisters in themselves; and by the second, because of the moisture that they have.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is that they are placed in locations where the body is affected, because the blisters that form on the head are different from those that form on the foot; and the blisters that form on the flesh are different from those that form in a joint; and each of them is a game for surgery.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	Some blisters are some that, if not pierced, but rather mature by the healing of the skin.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Some blisters are those that, if not pierced, but rather mature by the healing of the skin. They also have blisters that are broken when they cross over each other, and do not mature according to their completion, such as blisters that form near joints, because the blister that forms near a joint, the person's limb is prolonged until it can reach water that is in the circuit of the body, and badly corromps the ligaments or nerves of that joint, so that it causes pain to that member; or is a blister near a main member, and if you delay piercing it until it has not healed into another main member; or is near the rear, so pierce it not healed; and do not pierce the skin that does not heal properly, but rather pierce it in a way that reaches the split at the back, and causes a fistula, or makes a hole in the term of it that does not heal.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	If you know the time of the operation for the abscess, then it is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And know that it is mature when there is a decrease in pain and fever, and a decrease in pulse, and the hard center of the abscess, and the other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And know that the time for operation is when there is pus coming out in the place where the abscess was and pus coming out from the cure of the eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And know that the operation should be done when there is pain in the long bone of the body or in the trunk, if the abscesses are located in the joints of limbs or feet, and in places where the ligaments, nerves, or tendons are affected; and finally, in all locations that do not reflect, for in those that do, use the method of perforation according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But if the abscess is located in a bony place, then it is better to wait until its digestion has been completed, as I have already said; because if you perforate it before that time, you prolong the course of the poison in it and make the labia hard and deeper.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses should be perforated according to the thickness of the bone or body part that needs to be operated on, or according to which member it affects.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And when you administer a small perforation, and in large abscesses make wide or multiple cuts according to the variety of their size.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And of the abscesses in which it is necessary that the cord be cut and sutured, do so when it has healed a little, so that there will not be any problems with it; because if you make cuts in them without doing this, trouble may result.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that are not sutured, if they have three angles; and of those that are sutured, when it is done with the figure of a leaf, and when there are abscesses on the ankles.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of these that are operated on with round or lunar incisions, and similar ones.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But those who have no head and whose abscesses are superficial, know that you should not make a deep incision; but if you must do so, then make it shallow.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the abscess is large and has already collected some pus, know that you should perforate it and not cauterize it; take out a little at a time, and on another day take out a little more, and finally take out a lot, and according to the amount of pus that comes out, make the incisions deeper or wider.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And mainly if the patient is a man of strong vitality, or a woman, or a small child, or an old person in decrepitude; because the animal spirit has resolved to bring out the pus, and the body is weakened by it; so operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Keep this chapter in great caution; and when you administer the medicine to these abscesses, know that you abstain from using leeches or any other antiperspirant; but if the abscess is large and the cuts made are long, then know that you should put a stop to them.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess there is a piece of the cord that has been torn or cut, and it is sunk into the flesh, then know that you should stitch it up with old leather or linen thread; and when you have removed the scabs or the skin, wet them; and strengthen it on the third day; and finally treat it so that there will not be any more pain.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if there is a flow of blood during the operation, administer warm water and vinegar in which to soak a cloth; and place it on the area where the blood has flowed, so that it does not spread.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the flow of blood persists, know that you should administer the medicine and powder that I have recommended in many parts of this book concerning division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in winter time, and the area of the abscess is near a joint, then know that you should apply dust from vinegar mixed with oil and olive oil, and put it on the areas.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	But if it is in summer time, and the areas are fleshy, then know that you should apply dust from vinegar mixed with oil or water, and all this should be done on the third day; and finally treat it so that there will not be any more pain.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary to know about the treatment of abscesses in general; but according to the particular way that each case presents itself, I will now explain how to treat each one specifically.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter LXI.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the Incision of Abscesses in the Cord of the Head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the cord of the head there are small abscesses, and of two kinds: those that contain skin and fat, and those that contain bone only.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And of these are blisters, and of those is pus resembling lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And of those that contain fluid resembling milk, and similar to it; and of those that are hard and dry.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the incision of all of them, and in the extraction of those that do not cause pain, you should use cauterization to prevent infection.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation of cutting them is that you should use the instrument in the form which I will now describe, which is called an entremes; then know that it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if the fluid contained is moisture, then cut it with a superficial incision according to this shape:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin the incision of the line between B and G; then when the moisture is emptied out, then scrape off that which contains the moisture, and do not leave any trace of it, for five senses return if they remain: because there are five senses in one.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And dip it in Egyptian oil if there is any present, or salt water; and fill it with water, and leave it inside for another day, because water corrodes everything that lies under the film.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And dip it again in the oil a second and third time if it needs it, and leave it for another day; because you will not know if there is any left of that film unless you have cured the disease with oil, within which the disease is enclosed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	But if the abscess contains fat, then incise it according to this shape:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	A shallow incision with a shape like a croquet, and cut it between two lips of the incision and scrape out all of it, using your strength in extracting the skin that contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if your cauterization causes pain, then first of all I will tell you.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And perform the incision and treatment of the abscess according to what I have told you; and if the incised part is very dry, because it is a small amount of pus and little moisture, then know that it is almost finished.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And in some cases of these abscesses that are located on the head and affect older men; because there is no moisture in them, which causes pain when you cut into one with a scalpel; but if it is struck with a hammer, it will cause pain and break out like a blister.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other abscesses that are located on the head and affect children; because their hair is different from that of adults, and the incision for these should be very shallow.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And pause the puncture of those at the bottom of them in order that it be relieved to the patient's body from the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Then approach those who are called to that of cure.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter.xxii.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the section of scrofulas which occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	The following are to be found: in the neck, in the throat and in the jaw; and some also occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those which occur in the neck, and all scrofula from that part of the body are to be removed, and with them also those which occur in the throat and jaw, and any other parts.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	The substances of these scrofula are: some of them are blisters, and those which contain moisture, and the evil ones which do not yield to cure.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore in that part which you have found to be of good disposition in the Treatment, of which the color of the fluid is similar to the color of the grape, and it is deep all over, not attached to the nerves of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the air passages, and it is not thick, examine that with a small scalpel from the lower part of the body to the lower parts of the body along the line of G. within the line of B., and cut off that little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	It is more careful not to be cut into the veins or nerves.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And be careful not to cut into the veins or nerves; for if you were to cut into a vein or artery, and stop your work, then pause in the plague of threefold vinegar or other powders which cause a flow of blood, and examine that part where it is painful, and make it soft, and begin to decay.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood has been cut off.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore return to your work until you have finished it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	Then ask the patient if there is any pain from the other small scrofula, then cut those off and clean those.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of a large scrofula, be careful not to cut that scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	In advance, therefore, examine that with a sharp knife and leave it in place until it has fallen off of itself, unless it causes you harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Then fill the plague with cold water which you have already mixed with Egyptian oil, and then cure that.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you cut off the whole scrofula, then be careful not to cut more than necessary; for it is enough to remove what is surplus.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is any surplus of the scar by reason of the size of the scrofula, then be careful to cut off its root, and then remove it, and add a bit of oil.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And those scrofula which contain moisture, pierce that with a slight puncture here where the pus is seen to rise from the body surface, and pause the puncture of those at the bottom of them in order that it be relieved to the patient's body from the lower parts.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	Then approach the puncture, with oil and a similar liquid, in order that it may corrode the remaining pus;
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	Then when you see that the plague has been cleaned, then cure that with oil of generation until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter.xxxiii.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On the section of the scrofula which occurs in the throat between the lungs.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	They said that this section in the scrofula is of little account, and I did not see anyone in our country who had that.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	This is the inscription of the sermon of those.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But men have a tendency to be stubborn, therefore the extraction of the scrofula should be done with care, in order that it may not kill them, since all the veins and most of the body are affected.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have blisters on the lips or between them or on two ears; when the disease is not in the teeth, be careful of the section of the scrofula to avoid waste which is caused by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore when we want to measure water, let us mark off the section of the scrofula with three circles of the epiloot, or four in a small section for its length; let the section be made with a chisel and not with a saw, and this place is suitable for the section, since it takes away meat and the vessels of blood are cut.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the measure is small, then extend the cord of the throat to an ounce, and cut the cord within the channel, but avoid the vessels of blood, unless you see a cause for doing so.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	Then approach the section of the throat as we have described; and let a flame be raised over that part with oil, which is made from him, in order that it may dissolve it, and avoid the vessel of blood, unless you see a cause for doing so.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	Then leave the plague open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore when the hour is right for a puncture, which is convenient, add two layers of cord to the plague, and cut that off by itself, leaving it alone.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	Then administer medicine which causes the flesh to heal itself.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	It is said by Albucasis that the greatest exposition of this passage which we have described is that you see that some of those scrofula have already come out of the throat of the patient, and the patient's breath is cut off, and some are to be cut off from the epiglottis so that it may breathe through that part, and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And by water let the plague remain open until the evil of the scrofula is consumed; and that evil remains for three days; then, after three days, let the plague be thus closed, and cure those within it which may be healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And the water which I have seen with my own eyes, is that a servant hold a knife and cut off a part of the throat of the patient, and I was called to cure him; and I discovered the cause of the plague, and cured the blood which was caused by the plague.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Then you confessed that that did not cut any veins or arteries, and let the wind escape from the plague, and I healed those within it which were healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And if the servant did not return to his master in three days, then give him good medicine.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now let me tell you that there is no danger in the section of the scrofula.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter.xxxiv.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	On the section of the scrofula which occurs in the throat and is called a hernia.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This scrofula, which is called the hernia of the throat, is a large one according to the color of the body, and it occurs in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	It occurs in two ways; either it is innate or it is accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the innate there is no cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental is of two kinds; one is similar to knots in the throat, and the other is like a scrofula which is caused by the knotting of an artery, and there is danger in both.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And don't let him make assumptions on the patient until he has made small cuts.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you must carefully examine this area and if you see anything that looks like a lump of fat, and it is not suspended to any vein, then cut it with your scalpel at the base where it meets the skin, and extract it from there; but if not, then examine all of his body, and treat the affected area with some curative medicine before healing.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On section of the nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of the nodes, there are some specific techniques that I have already mentioned in the division of the body.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	I will explain here the difference between a node and an exit with doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	And so you will know that an exit is hot and painful, and has a violent fever and perspiration; and putrid matter which, when it stops the fever, the pain, and the heat, is complete.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But in a node there is no heat or fever or pain; it is covered with a thin layer of leather-like skin, which is its own natural cover.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And its color in the body is second to that of blood; and its beginning is with a vein, either large or small, and it is made up of two kinds of spirits: one dry and the other moist, and their colors are according to what I have already said in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	So, when you approach the cure of a node, you should extract it and examine its beginning with the instrument called an intromiser, according to which I will explain in the next chapter.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And this is the way to examine abscesses and all nodes; that is, you take this instrument and insert it into the area affected by pus, and you stir with it little by little until you are sure that the instrument has already penetrated the core.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And finally return your hand according to the measure of the size of the abscess, and extract the intromiser and consider what is remaining in its path.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if any of the moisture remains, whatever color it may be, then you should carefully cut it at the surface according to what I have said in other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no moisture remaining in the intromiser's path, then you will know that it is fat.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry it on top of the cut surface according to this shape:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	as I have taught you, and suspend it with nails, and cut the core from all parts with ease, and save the skin or the sack, if you can, over that one; and extract that blood to the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken during the operation, it is not possible to extract that blood, and you will see it flowing out, and then you should extract it little by little until it stops; because if it flows continuously, it would be difficult for the patient to survive.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if it causes any pain, a little or too much, the node returns according to its own nature.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you think that it causes any small part to cause pain, then completely corrode it with some sharp corrosive powder and strengthen the corrosion, and place it on the area affected by the abscess, and treat it with some other cure until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large node, then you should cut its two sides and extract it with the blood that comes out.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if the pulse at that location is pulsating or not pulsating, then you should bandage it and apply the vinegar to that spot for three days in order to stop the pain and allow the wound to heal; and then return to cut what remains of the node.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	On the necessary forms of the instruments for section and piercing.
De aquels so las formas dels intromesas, e so de tres specias, que de aquels es alcu gran, e de lor es migier, e de lor es petit.	Of those three types of intromers, two are large, one is medium, and the third is small.
La forma de intromes gran es aquesta:	The shape of a large intromer: It has an elongated shape with a sharp point at one end, like a needle, and it is used to pierce through tissue.
La forma de intromes migier es aquesta:	The medium-sized intromer has an oval or round shape with a blunt end, similar to a knife blade, and it is used for sectioning tissue.
La forma de intromes petit es aquesta:	The small intromer has a flat, triangular shape with a sharp point on one end, similar to a chisel, and it is used for cutting and peeling away layers of tissue.
Sian faytz de ferr, de alfulud, de extremitatz cayradas decentment, per so que festino le intrament en les apostemas.	If you sharpen them properly, with a sharp edge and slightly curved ends, so that the instrument easily enters the node.
E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.	And these are the forms of experience, which are simply known as alberneds, and one of those is called birid.
E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.	Of the three types, two are large, one is medium, and the third is small.
La forma de experient gran, forma de lu:	The shape of a large experiment is like a flat circle or oval, sometimes with a slight indentation at the center, and it represents a complete circle or a curve.
La forma de experient migier, forma de lu:	The medium-sized experiment has a rounded shape, often with a slightly pointed end, like a drop of water hanging from a blade, and it represents an arc or a curve.
La forma de experient pauc, forma de lu:	The small experiment has a flat, triangular shape with rounded corners, similar to a leaf, and it represents a curve or an arch.
Conveneysso que sian per aquels apostemas e exituras e fistulas e bubos per so que entre aquelas so dels osses e de autras causas.	Let us remember that these are for abscesses, hernias, and fistulas, as well as boils, which are of the bones or other causes.
E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	And they are round, large and small needles, sewn with linen thread, and made with lemon resin, or iron or silver, and the majority are made with lemon resin.
E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.	And they are made of black plums, which it is agreed that for those they open the fistulas in the concave parts where they are reflected, which are reflected in their own light.
E so de tres specias, quar alcus de lor so loncs, e dels autres migiers, e dels autres breus, segon la quantitat del ample de la fistula e de la strictura de lu.	Of the three types, two are long and thin, and the third is medium-sized, and the fourth is short, according to the amount of width of the fistula and its narrowness.
Forma del experient gran de plom:	The shape of a long experiment is like a thin rod or stick, sometimes slightly curved, and it represents a length or a width.
Forma del experient migier de plom:	The medium-sized experiment is made with a flat, rectangular shape, often with rounded edges, and it represents an area or a surface.
Forma del experient petit de plom:	The short experiment has a triangular shape, sometimes with one side slightly curved, and it represents a depth or a height.
Las formas dels oncis so de motas specias, quar de aquels so alcus simples, als quals es una curvitat solament, e so de tres specias: grans, paucs e migiers.	The shapes of nails are of two kinds, some are simple, which have only one curve, and there are three types: large, small, and medium-sized.
E de lor so uncis orps, e so de tres specias.	And they are called orp nails, and there are three types of them.
E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And they have two curves, and there are three types of them.
E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And they have three curves, and there are also three types of them.
E totz aquetz so necessaris en lor loc.	All of these are necessary in their place.
Forma de unci simple gran, forma de lu:	The simple large nail has a curved shape with one point at each end, similar to a hook, and it is used for piercing or holding together layers of tissue.
Forma de unci simple migier:	The simple medium-sized nail has an oval or round shape with a slight curve, similar to a knife blade, and it is used for sectioning and peeling away tissue.
Forma de unci simple pauc, forma de lu:	The small simple nail has a flat, triangular shape with rounded corners, similar to a leaf, and it represents an arch or an arc.
Forma de unci orp gran:	The large orp nail has an elongated shape with two curves and a pointed tip at each end, like a pair of scissors, and it is used for cutting tissue layers.
Forma de unci orp migier, forma de lu:	Form a hook from silver or lead, shape it like this:
Forma de unci orp pauc, forma de lu:	Form a hook of silver or lead, shape it like this:
Forma de unci gran havent dos curvaturas:	Form a large hook that has two curves:
Forma de unci migier havent dos curvatas:	Form a small hook that has two curves:
Forma de unci pauc havent dos curvaturas:	Form a small hook that has two curves:
Forma de unci gran havent tres curvaturas:	Form a large hook that has three curves:
Forma de unci migier havent tres curvaturas:	Form a small hook that has three curves:
Forma de unci pauc havent tres curvaturas:	Form a small hook that has three curves:
E aquestas so las formas dels scalpels am les quals son seccatz e scorjatz les nodes e le apostemas, e so de tres specias, quar de aquels es gran, migier, e pauc.	And these are the shapes of the scalpels that cut and scratch knots and warts; there are three kinds, each one larger, medium, and small.
Forma de scapel gran:	Shape of a large scalpel:
Forma del scapel migier:	Shape of a medium scalpel:
Forma de scapel pauc:	Shape of a small scalpel:
Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The ends of these are sharp and the other ends are not, they are not held in such a way, but so that it is quickly made in theexcision of knots fear of incision of veins or nerves, and for this it is cured of the patient and sometimes there is a little relief by the drying up of the wart.
E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.	And these are the shapes of the poultices, and there are three kinds: large, medium and small, thus:
La forma de magda gran:	Shape of a large poultice:
Forma de magda migier:	Shape of a medium poultice:
Forma de magda pauc:	Shape of a small poultice:
Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.	When made from wax and resembling rays, which is made with alcohol.
E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	And it is on the sharp edge punctured with hidden spice and on that course inside and outside, when you want, thus:
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	The shapes of the spatum, which are placed between the thighs in order to perforate the warts and not feel the pain of the patient, and there are three kinds: large, medium and small.
E aquestas so las formas de aquels:	And these are the forms of those:
Las formas de ventozas am las quals es abscindit le flux del sanc, e so de tres specias; gran, migiera e pauca; las formas de lu:	The shapes of the wind instruments with which the flow of blood is stopped, and there are three kinds: large, medium and small; the forms of the feet:
Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	When made from wax or resin, round and of a certain length, and thin.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	And these kinds of wind instruments should be large, medium and small, so that by their stopping the flow of blood quickly, and then when you first start practicing medicine.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	However, you do not use them to stop the blood from flowing throughout the body, but only in certain places, such as the skin folds, legs, and feet; also on the skin of the chest, breasts, and belly, and the shoulders, which are covered with hair.
E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	Some small wind instruments are made in the shape of small scours like this; with them the blood is stopped when made by phlebotomy, or incision of a vein or artery.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	Some wind instruments are made round according to this form:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter xliv.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the treatment of male breasts which are assembled from female breasts.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some wind instruments are inflated breasts of old men with fine skin, and then inflate the breasts, and assemble the breasts of female breasts, and Roman breast implants, thin.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you agree with me, consider cutting those which are divided by the lunar line according to this form, from the line B within the line G, and then remove all ugliness, and then employ a cure for incurable disease, and then join the two lips of the wound together, and heal that within which is to be healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	If the breast declines and splits into two parts and is softened by its size, consider cutting it in half from top to bottom, like a figure of a moon, where each half is contained within the other one, as if the main line contains the smaller one according to this form of the line from B within the line from G. And then remove the skin which is between the two lips of the wound, and stop the bleeding, and administer what is necessary for the treatment of a sore that needs suturing, and powder it so that it heals.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not agree with me about cutting that which I cut from the worry of the patient and from the flow of blood, consider cutting it as I have done, immersing it in a corrosive solution, and then join that which it has corroded, which is made of the grey, and then heal that within which needs to be healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter xlvii.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Of the perforation of warts that come from the inside out.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	Those warts that come from the inside out are of the species of sores, dry skin, which is a sort of crust.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And of those few that contain moisture; and those that contain moisture are cut in half from top to bottom according to this figure: from the line G to the line B. And when all the liquid has been evacuated, consider it a cure for scurvy, and join it again another day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And then let the cutting be kept in place, and be cured with a suitable ointment applied to water, so that it heals.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the wart of the node is there, and of the sores, consider cutting it off from above, as I have said in the section on scurvy.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	May consider if the wound is extended to the area that needs to be heated, then administer it according to what I have said before.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter xlix.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Of the perforation of warts that occurs through an artery or vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is broken and the cord is compressed which is over that, consider it a wart seen from above, as I said before, that inflammation and warts are caused by an artery or vein; for when the warts occur through an artery, they are long agglutinated in the preon of the body; and that when you cut them off with small knives, you feel a strangeness.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And what happens through a vein is seen from all sides.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And cutting through this wart is wrong, and mostly in places where the skin folds, and on the shoulders, and in many parts of the body; it is big, so that its treatment with iron may be avoided, and what is at the ends, or at the top, is to be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	May consider if it happens due to inflammation of the orifice of an artery, cut it in half; and then open the cord, and free the nerves, so that they are uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then let that needle pass through there, and let it go into the other, and join the artery with a double knot in two places; which causes an injury to your heart in the extraction of two arteries that are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then cut off the place between the two threads with a sharp knife, so that it stops the blood completely while being inside, and dissolve the wart.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer a cure which is caused by fire, so that the threads fall down; and heal it with a suitable ointment applied to water, so that it heals.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if the wart is caused by incision of a vein, consider it that you have on your hand what you cut off from your hand, and then let a needle pass through there; and make a double knot in the middle, so that you extract one of the two parts of the thread, and join the wart with one line according to what I have said before about the use of a double knot.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	May I then fear that they will tear the thread, let him insert the needle first and all the blood should be cut with the first incision of the needle, and tighten the threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the wound in its place until it is well and when you see that it is already healing, then cut off the excess of the knot, and let it remain that way.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then place over him the pulse which you have dipped in wine and oil, and administer the cure which is made with calamus and inkwell until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Take care of the wound that happens due to twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	As soon as you see that an aposteme happens in the artery and vein, and apparently an aposteme happens in the nerves when you hit them or due to excessive work, and apparently.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	It is done by hand in the places of the assistants or of the tail, or in any place where the joints are massaged.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a painful apoplexy, and it resembles the color of the other limbs, and it is in the major parts of him that he loses consciousness, and when it is treated with violence, he feels a kind of stupor in him.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an apoplexy that occurs in the front of the body, and therefore the knot is left, and he becomes paralyzed all over, and does not go forward or backward.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore from those who are in the joints do not cover that it is enfused with iron, for it would produce a strong counter-action.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But he who is on the head or forehead let him be with a needle.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a slight apoplexy, then you should put him in the foal and cut off that which is rotted.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is great, then you should suspend him with a chain, and extract that which has rotted, and then stop it; and sew the wound, and heal it quickly.

De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Of the apoplexy that occurs from the mouth and occurs in the abdomen.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Introduce a those who have swelled bellies and other parts of the body that are similar to funguses, of which the root is small and the head of those who are big; and also those whose lips are swollen, and those who are small, and those who are swollen in many places.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	You have already seen one, and in his abdomen there were two things that resembled fungi, and there was no difference between them as to whiteness, their roots being small.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips of those people were turned inside out and they bled constantly.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore you cut off those people and sewed them up in eighteen places. and the other had one.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation in cutting them up is that you consider if the patient is hot, and the color of his skin is white, wet, and the roots are small; then cut him with a sharp knife, and if he bleeds, cauterize him. Because if you stop bleeding, cauterize him.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if the patient is a little bit scared and frightened, do not cut him with iron; but rather take recently made lead, and tighten it on that part which has rotted, in the same way as you have told us; and let it remain for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Then tighten the lead thread tightly; therefore, do not stop tightening the large lead thread until it is cut and fallen by itself, and because of that work.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the root is thick, then in the incision of him there is no cause for fear and anxiety, and more so in that which is in the abdomen.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	It is possible that you cut off most of it, and then cauterize him so that he does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	Then heal the wound in which the plague has occurred.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to cut off that part of the flesh which is of a dark color, has little feeling, and looks backward, for that part is cancerous.
