Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	Maybe if the fistula is very twisted, then investigate it with a thin iron rod, because an iron that has light weight and can move the body's shape is easy to curve out of the twists.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula is not very large or terrifying, it is not in your power that you can examine it with an iron rod.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Then clean the opening with a sharp knife, because the moisture that you clean out goes to the other openings and runs from them.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	Then inquire very carefully, according to which method you can understand whether there are bones or nerves here; and it is the concave shape of the fistula that is far away or near, or it is a fistula with only one opening and it is over this; completely covering the whole body with your dressing, and inquiring about the causes and the accidental factors of the swelling.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	Then when you have considered all these causes at length, then go to the treatment according to confidence: and it is that you consider if it is a fistula in a nearby part or far from a joint, or a nerve, or an artery, or a vein, or any of the places I have mentioned to you and said.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then you clean the fistula according to what has been said before in the description of it, and those who have been said to be in the fistula; and from those who are in the fistula, some are born in the opening of the flesh, or in the teeth and similar things, and heal them within it.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	Maybe if the fistula is very deep, and is following its course, then clean it with a sharp blade as much as you can, and then remove all corrupt flesh from it; and then introduce sharp medicines into it, and put them within the concave shape of the fistula, which you have understood with an iron.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	Then put that medicine into the fistula, within a few layers of cloth, so that it corrodes everything that is rotten in the concave shape of the fistula because of the acute medicine.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	Then restore it with clean clothes that generate healthy flesh within which is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	Maybe if it is not healed by water, then you cauterize it according to what has been said before.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	Maybe if the cause of the fistula is bone and you must examine it, then you clean it according to what has been said before; and if you do not find any cause of vein or nerve or main member as I have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	Maybe if the bone is discovered and it is in some corruption and darkness, then you clean out all that corruption completely; and then heal it with water so that it is healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and it gushes out completely, as when it has dried up, you know that you have not achieved the total eradication of the corruption; and then you discover again in a second examination and very carefully the reason for it and the cause of its origin; and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And if it has been healed, then it is well; but if not, you know that the corruption is in the depth of the body, which has not been achieved, and then in that you must keep looking for a cure.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	Maybe if the bone is corrupt it is small, or if you can reach it; then throw it with sharp tweezers that are useful for this purpose and to cut off any part of the body that is corrupt.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if it is only bones, then very carefully remove all of them, and do not leave any cause that can harm you with your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	Maybe if you have any opposite causes of the moisture, and in their cutting there is neither fear nor mistake; then cut those limbs or flesh if it is here, and free the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	Maybe if you have not prepared yourself to cut the bones of your body, then pause over the wound with a knife that can be used for this purpose; and let that wound rest while you cut the limbs from the flesh and limbs, leaving the wound in place where those bones were cut from the body, and keep the wound covered so that it is not healed, and keep the section that you have cut in your operation.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Here is the translation of the first sentence in this text:
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	Here is the translation of this sentence:
Forma de serra:	The shape of the saw
Forma de autra serra:	Other shapes of saws:
Forma de autra serra:	Other shapes of saws:
Forma de autra serra gran:	Form of another great line:
Forma de ray:	Form of line:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	The shape of this line is according to the shape of the starry claw, and the points of it are according to the shape of the althazic points.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And there is not a need for anything else than that those be cut if they are rotten at the joints, or if it is the large open mouth.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Form of the main razor of the others:
Forma de razori menor:	Form of the lesser razor:
Forma de razori lat:	Form of a lateral razor:
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	Form of another proper line: Be it done with a certain line that is made like an arc and its sharpness is forged from iron, and the member is made like a knife in a proper way.
Forma de lu:	Form of him:
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Form of a razor in which there is a depression:
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Form of another subtle razor:
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Form of another razor with a curved extreme end:
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Form of a small razor resembling a tentacle:
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	Form of a set of teeth which are engraved on the bones:
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Form of another lesser incision:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Form of another incision; this one resembling a line, and its extreme end is a little saw, and it is exhibited in places on the bones' edge:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Form of a line that goes to the shape of that which pierces the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its extreme end is triangular and has an acute tip.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	It is made of Indian iron, and its appearance seems to indicate that all the causes that we have mentioned of razors, of incisions, and of saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incision's extreme ends and of the locking of the bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extreme ends may be pierced or, for an intrinsic cause, or for an extrinsic cause, or if you do not cure those diseases with those medicines, and if sometimes the corruption does not affect any part, then it is said that the patient should remove that member from within which the corruption arises, because the bad influence goes away by water from death or from a malicious thing, which is a greater defeat of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that person is that the member becomes black within, so that it is cured when fire burns it, or if you cut off that blackness near that part which causes the corruption, or if it is removed far from that part which causes the corruption in that member which affects all the body; and therefore, cut off that member.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And in general, if it is caused by the corruption of some poisonous things, then such as from a scorpion, or from a bat, or from a rat, and from similar things.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or piercing is at the extreme end, then you should cut off that part and not give space for the corruption to go away, so it does not enter the body.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And if you are affected in the arm, then you should cut off that part of the edge of fire, and not give space for the corruption to enter into the body's fire.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if instead of that member, then cut off the arm in the junction.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if another corruption or the vice moves the patient's body, then that person dies; and a quantity of virtue is administered in order to cure it.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And if the corruption occurs at the foot instead of that part, then cut off that part within one of the feet.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it is in the heel of the foot, then you should cut off all the foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	Or if it is in the instep, then you should cut off the instep within the junction of the instep.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already affected the heel, then there is only one remedy, and that is to remove it; and let the patient die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the way of cutting off a member or sawing it in half is that you tighten the ligament at the joint further, and then strengthen another ligament on the spot; and extend the ministering ligament to the spots further apart, and then strengthen another ligament on them; and then separate the flesh which is between two ligaments, and then cut off or saw it.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	That is done with a sharp knife, or with a pointed one, in order that the ligament may not be cut and that the patient' harm may be adjusted and that the swelling may subside quickly.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	Or if you are working while there is a fever, then you should cauterize the place with care, or put on it some powdered resin; and return to your medicine until it is finished.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind that member which is infected with a ligament that suits it, and cure it within so that it heals.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	I recommend to you that you go to a man in the service of whom this mistake occurred, who is black in his leg due to a fire that was burning together with him.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	That corruption first occurred in his foot, which extends to the whole body.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepared himself in advance to cure that member with the same urgency as his pain and his thirst for it, and he cut off that foot within the junction, and fire healed it.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Long time passed before it occurred to him that corruption in the man's arm occurred by accident.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then he went to me, and then I repaired myself by applying a medicine on the body, with the change of the man' mind; and the excess of that medicine did not affect him, and it began to act on the other arm which had been affected first.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he called on me to cut off his arm, and I did not want to do so, hoping that there would be no effect from that excess medicine, and yet I had to cut off his arm at once, because the man' evil was greater than his good.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And then he left me, and returned to his own country, and sent for me that man; and I cut off all of his arm, and it healed him.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I will not add any more to this narrative except that it is useful for me who can understand it, and that it may be beneficial for others.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of cure of diseases and quality of clisterization with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When there is a swelling in some large members of the body, and the space of that swelling is prolonged within so that it does not collect pus, then it bursts and pierces, and drains off the pus from it; and if it opens up towards the back as if it were a vein, and if it opens up in the way that the skin separates, and does not come into contact with bone or nerve or ligament, it is called an abscess, and it is not named a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	Or if the space is prolonged in such a way that the corruption goes into another member, then it is called a fistula, and not a lump.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure of it is that you cut off all that cord, and more so when it is softened and made thin with a cloth; and you ensure that it does not stick to the place because of its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	Or if you hope that the cord does not adhere and that that corruption has not succeeded by a last consequence, and if it is opened in front, then you cure it with a clister.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And consider the sinus, and if it is large, and the arm that you are considering has an unpleasant odor, then clisterize it with Egyptian medicine which is made of oil, honey, and vinegar mixed together; and place it in a vessel, and apply fire to it until it boils and reaches the top.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And so you take from him that which is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; and make a clister with it to the stomach, tighten its orifices, and leave the medicine with him for two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	Then extract it with care; and make water for so many days within that it purifies the stomach and restores the appetite.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And some enemas are made with ash-water, when you do not have this medicine present; and that you take the ash from wine, and put it on the water; and mix that well, and make a clister with it within that you swear that the stomach remains stopped.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient does not tolerate the Egyptian medicine or ash-water, then make a clister with water and honey and mix it with three parts of senna; and make a clister with wine and honey mixed, since honey has the property to purify and wash, and wine adheres to the stomach, and especially when there is an excess of constipation and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have made water a few times and are satisfied that the stomach has been restored, then make a clister with water in which the flesh adheres to it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And that you take a remedy of daphnicum and dissolve it in rosin and wine for stipticism; or that you make a clister with some medicines and anoint others that have the properties that I have already described in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifices of the stomach are narrow and cannot receive the clister, then you widen them little by little with a small iron; and place a few folds of cloth coated with Egyptian ointment or basil ointment on it so that it is widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And if the orifices are wide, then you stitch together the lips of the opening and leave the quantity in which the clister is added to the stitches.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening from which the arm branches out is raised above the nipple, then dry that place with a poultice in which the arm is forced to move upwards; for when the arm is constrained at the breast, the flesh becomes engorged.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the stomach completely around the hip, then you should pierce that member so that the arm can move easily according to your desire and your clothing; and so that it is not held back by any cause of the arm.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines that are placed on the stomach, conveniently wet with water, so that those applied to a cloth are spread out.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And make the cloth of a size that makes it communicate completely with the entire stomach; and cut with a sharp pair of scissors on the right side of the opening of the stomach an edge wider than the opening, and stretch another cloth on top of it, wet with lion's ointment according to the quantity of the edge; and place it so that it is distant from the opening of the stomach by a distance greater than the width of the arm, and leave it there for several days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	And if you want that which is on the opening of the stomach remains stopped throughout the day so that it does not leak any water that causes a swelling in the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And to know if the water that runs from the arm is little or much, whether it is digested or not digested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And while you are at it, consider the position of that stomach, whether there is pain in it, and if so, whether it is accompanied by swelling.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your medicine has been prolonged in such a way that you see the matter that is adhering to the opening of the stomach already adhered, or if it has become attached, then every third day, and when you remove the cloth, change the cloth and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	Consider if the opening of the stomach is large enough to let in a subtil virus; do not despair of the attachment of the flesh, for healing is acquired, because some people heal quickly and others slowly.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	If the arm is digested after a few days, you will know that the stomach does not adhere; and if the adhesion of the stomach occurs due to prolonged causes, then you should adjust the medicines, and if the medicines are moist in their substance or property, make them dry with daphnicum ointment, when there is an excess of addition of poultice.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the last to be cured is that you take daphnicum ointment and dissolve it in rosin oil, and put it on with a small brush, and use that one.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And you will soon see the effect of this action, for when there is no arm, use daphnicum ointment, honey when it is thick within that it hardens, and use it; or that you take mirra and aloe, and mix them together, and grind them thoroughly on a plate, and sprinkle them on the cloth and tighten them over the stomach; and sprinkle the honey that you have ground together with the myrrh on the cloth and tighten it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes you give them a long-acting aristology of the lilac from heaven (and it is the lilac from heaven) and flour of erba centaurea, and use that simple or prepare it, grind them together, and pass them through a sieve, and sprinkle them on the honey that I have mentioned; and use it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	If the stomach is prolonged and has not been cured with this medicine, you will know that corruption is in its pocket, and if it is in the bones or in other hard members or at the joints; then you cure it with a surgical incision, as is done from above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the Cure of Parathyriditis and the Application of Ointment and Incision on the Toe and its Section.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Parathyriditis is an apothesis that does not allow the nail of the foot of the hand or the foot to fall off; and if it is prolonged and its treatment is not successful, or it is an apothesis from apothema, or it is corrupted, and the finger becomes corroded, and the nail corroded, and the tip of the finger becomes black; then cut off the extremity of that finger, and its color will turn dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And when you have made a division of that finger with water as I have said, then cut off all the excess that is rotten from the nail, and cauterize the wound with fire, because cauterization is beneficial in such cases.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and if the additions of the nail are already causing the flesh to separate at the joints, and if it begins to putrefy and to rot, then stop prying the nail off the flesh with force; and cut off that part of the nail that prickles the flesh, and push that away, and place on it a poultice that heals.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	If corruption has already set in the bone, then cut off that bone and extract it, for no time is there when the bone is not corrupted.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if corruption and rotting have set in on the finger, then cut off that finger according to its length, so that you do not lose memory of it; and cure it within that it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	If there is percussion or atricio on the nail, and if that pain is violent, then cut off the finger of the hand with a transverse section through the nail, and be careful not to cut into the flesh that is next to the nail; because you will make the finger fall off, causing severe pain, and this leads to a premature birth in the wound. And cure that place with water that soothes pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	May's dit is adjusted, which is born in the legs of some men, very little meat is present everywhere, and very little flesh is there in the feet or very little in the hands.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born at the root of the joint, or the birth of some of them is in the nuts of these words.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	May' who was born in some of the nuts of this word does not get hurt, and he who is born in the joints is very well grown.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And of those who are born with flesh, the section is light, and it is because you cut that part with a knife.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	May' of those who are born at the root of the joint, the cure is difficult, and so you should keep away from the incision.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	May' in that who is born in the nuts of this word, cover that you cut at the beginning the meat of him with a round incision through the bone, and place it near one of those saws that are convenient to water, and then cure him from inside so that he is healed.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	May' consolidation that happens in these things between them is seen or by the birth of the man who is born there, or by the consolidation of plague or by fire, or by similarity, therefore when you dry up that consolidation so that those things return to their natural shape.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	Then place between them a thin layer of lead so that they are not consolidated too much, and separate them, or place between them a thin piece of wood so that it is hardened according to what needs to be done.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And in case consolidation happens in some of these things in the palm, then dry up that consolidation according to what needs to be done and form it into the shape of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of the incision of veins, such are varices.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins wrapped around thick, filled with sad fluids that come from the joints of the body, and most of them enter into the legs, and especially in those of travelers, workers, and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then administer purge of black cholera from time to time with strong vomit, and draw blood from the patient from the basal vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	May' the cure of them is according to two ways: one is that he be cut and that black blood be drawn from him, and the other way is that the vein be lifted and all be extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The section of him is according to this way: dip the leg at the beginning with a tail that blood comes out from it, which is resolute in the leg, and dry up the vein in one place, or two, or three with an extensive incision, and lift black blood from above the knee at the beginning of the leg at the part where it joins to the thigh with a cloth, and then dry up the vein in one place, or in two, or in three with an extensive incision, and lower black blood from below the knee at the end of the leg at the part where it joins the thigh, and then take out as much as you want and that the patient can tolerate, and which has a medicine effect.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	Then bind him up, and order him to abstain from black cholera-inducing foods.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	Repeat the cure by phlebotomy when veins are filled and the patient feels ill.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	May' the elevation of them is according to this way: if you cut the leg of the patient, and then place him in a bath, dip the leg into water so that it swells and veins are filled; or exercise him strongly through exercise, if a bath is not available, so that the member is scraped.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	Then dry up the vein in the right place by incision in the long or in the back of it, or at the bottom of it, or at the top of it, cut off with a knife.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	Then open the vein with a blade and squeeze it from all parts until blood appears, and that is how that color changes towards blackness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And then pour out and from the vein you will get that white thing which is called cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	Then place there below it a tray so that it rises and is taken away from the vein, and hang that white thing by an ounce of gold.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	Then dry up another incision near that incision for three cuts, and then squeeze the vein from above of the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then lift that one up and cut it in the back section of it, and then squeeze out that one and lift it up from where it comes out through the second incision, and then take out that one from the section that is on top of it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	Then take out that one from the section that is on top of all or at the bottom of all sections, and it is all extracted; then cut it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you do not obey me in taking it out and lifting it up, then insert a double sharp needle into it and tie it off, or turn the patient over on his back and take it out with your hand to all parts where it is placed.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	Keep in mind that if it is broken, then cut it difficult to lift that leg and it comes back on the patient by that wound.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when all of it has come out, then place over the spot of the plague that is submerged in water and oil that is red and not red, and cure that one from inside so that it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the wine is contracted without having tortuosity that is wrapped around the parts, and it is not according to what we have said, then place over those parts where there is no tortuosity of him and the places where he is wrapped up, and then suspend that one with a blade from all parts so that you lift him up completely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	Keep in mind that your incision should not hurt the vein and that wound, because it will be difficult for you to lift that leg; and serve your prudence with it.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Shape of the incision that is dried up:
Forma de unci orp:	Shape of the white cord:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It should not be acute, because it will hurt the vein; and it is of coarse flexibility, because if it were subtle, it would cut the vein for its subtlety; let us have such grossness when we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the extraction of a leg vein.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in flat places when it rains in Arabic lands and dry lands of little moisture and in which there is no grass or shade.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is very well generated in other parts of the body, except for the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	The gestation of it is from rot that comes out of the vein when there are snakes and worms and snails and vermin generated between the vein and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	The sign of the arrival of it is from this vein that happens in the leg inflammation with great violence, and then the place is swollen; and then the vein comes out from the part of that swelling as if it were the root of a plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And when you see the end of him, then cover that one piece of lead from which his feet hang in two dragons, and do not break that one and leave the lead suspended from the chest.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And when you see that there is some cause for concern outside the body, wrap it in lead and burn it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it is prolonged, then cut a piece of lead and wrap it around it; and do not cut that which has been burnt from the outside, for if you cut it, it will contract and penetrate the flesh, causing pus and bad ulcers in the place and a malignant ulcer.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	So that it may be treated gently and be taken out little by little, except for the last piece of lead from behind, so that there is no cause for concern in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein I have extracted in some men who were of the length of five hands and of two fingers, and now it has come to me that I extract one of twenty palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is cut in the hour of its medicine, then introduce a needle into the center of the lead and pierce it with a long needle through the body, so that all the matter is evacuated, and administer putrefaction to the place for several days with medicines; and then cure it with the treatment of ulcers.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has bumps, and mainly when it appears in the joint of the foot or in the foot, and comes out from each hole, and is extracted from each hole.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore cure that one as we have said above in the division and at the water that is said above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of sections on worms that are generated under the skin and it is called a bovine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is called in some countries bovine disease because the worms are found in the bowels and they are few, but one is born between the rectum and the flesh, and enters the whole body, pushing and breaking down, and showing itself to the outer side of the skin.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And the generation of it is by putrefaction of certain humors, so that worms and snakes and earthworms and roundworms are generated in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared for the maliciousness of it, for when it goes into the body and rises to the head, and has come to the throat, then suddenly it breaks out into a sore in it and destroys the throat, and where it does not break out, worms are found.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore, when you want to treat it and extract it, then do not do so unless you have walked around it and observed its appearance, and then find out that you strangle it tightly and press it firmly, and then dry it on it and extract it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is pressing on the flesh and you do not observe it, then pause a cauterizing fire over the place where it is, and the most feared cause is the corruption of it as we have said above.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	And if you see that the disease has come to the throat close to the throat, then strangle it tightly with a rope, and then dry it on it, and extract it; and let the patient use medicine for evacuating the bad humors, and keep away from food that generates putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of sections on disease that is not serious.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called in our country "not serious", and it is a painful disease that appears in some members, and then changes from one member to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And you have already seen that second thing that I recommend to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	A woman with disease was brought to a town, and I discovered her arms, and saw a small swelling in the vein of the arm, and it continued to grow larger for an hour, and then smaller, but more quickly than if it had been air, as if it were liquid silver flowing from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	Then she went out of that person's pain in that place and came back to her body, and then he sat there for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it moved into the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then I told him that I would turn it around all over the body, as you have seen me do; and he was very amazed by the change of direction of the arm and the speed from one member to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I have already seen ahead of that second way, but this time, however, I saw the changes from one member to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	I did not see it with my own eyes as it was in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And you did not think it was there, but by water because the woman was from a nearby village, where the bodies are cold and the veins are open, and in this way the movement appeared to your eyes.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that it does not appear like this reverse cure in those who are delicious and have soft veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And if you want to cure it and the patient feels pain, then do not appear to him as we have said above, then strangle that person and dry it on it, and stop up that opening, and cauterize the place.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it with your own eyes, then treat that person with the treatment of the body and the water that you expel, and with pills made from fermented wine and others that resemble it.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Of extracting the arrow.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are different according to their spices, and according to the places of the bodies in which they have been shot, because their diversity is that some of them have large tips, and small ones, and concave ones, and flat ones, and that they are solid; and that some of them have three angles, and those to which they have tongues.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the members and the places in which they have been hit is according to two ways: because the principal members with convex shapes are the neck, heart, and chest, and lungs, and breasts, and bladder, and similar ones; but when you find that these death-like symptoms appear in some of those members, then you avoid extracting that arrow from them, as I have recommended to you before, then if you do not see those bad signs, and the arrow does not become hidden in the depth of the member, then extract it and cure the plague.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the nerves of the face when the arrow hits them and pierces the bone, and is extracted from the mouth, which is over the neck, because it happens with violent sudoration, and blushing, and dizziness, and loss of speech, and vomiting of colic, and suddenly the word disappears and is destroyed; and a white moisture resembling pus comes out from that place, and there is a similarity to the secretion of the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore, if you see those symptoms, then you abstain from treating and extracting the arrow, unless it is outside the body.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the arrow that hits the heart is so near to the left arm that it is stuck in a hard place, and there is no pain; and suddenly the movement of the arrow is similar to the pulse's movement, and black blood comes out from the plague, and freezes the extremities, and makes a noise, and faints; and if you know that death has taken hold of all.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the members when the arrow has struck the chest and is coming out from the other side in a frothy plague, and those vessels that are close to the throat open up, and the color of the patient changes, and he breathes hard and asks for fresh air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow hits the veal that is on the foot, and the pain then is close to the small toes, and it stops up all the limbs' muscles with great pain and a sigh, and does not move any of its members.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if he swallows the dart in his stomach, then let him eat no other food until the pain goes away.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if he swallows the dart and it gets stuck in his stomach, or if there is a rupture of the plague, or hernia that has broken out, then there is no hope for the extraction of the dart.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the dart enters the bladder and passes urine outside, causing a rupture outside, then there is a strong pain on the patient's thighs; know that it is deadly.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	May the other members also suffer as it is with the face, the neck, the jaw, the shoulders and the back, and the spondylosis of the spine, and the hernia, and the pelvis, and the legs, and similar limbs; are saved according to the major dispositions when the dart does not hit a vein or artery and is not a venenous dart.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I recommend that you watch out for the nature of these darts, so that you know how to treat them accordingly.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	This is the cause, for in a man a dart enters his eye at the root of his nose, and I extracted it from him through another opening, cut off his ears, and he was healed, and nothing happened to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another dart from a Jew which had entered his eye at the root of his nose, cut off his eyelids, and the dart was hidden; it was not visible except for a small end sticking to his eyelash. It was a sharp dart of the Turks, with an iron point, such that there are no ears.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And so the Jew remained, and nothing bad happened to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another dart from a Christian which had entered his jaw; it was an Arabic dart, and there were no ears; then I cut off two teeth next to each other, and that was where the dart was hidden; then I extracted it, and he was healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another dart from a man which had entered his belly; I thought he was going to die of the dart, but after thirty days it did not turn for any reason of its dispositions, so I cut off the dart and it healed him, and nothing bad happened to him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw another man in whom a dart entered his two legs; it solidified the plague on him, and after three years the dart entered the space between his thighs.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman in whom a dart entered her belly; the plague solidified inside her, and it did not change its dispositions according to nature, and the woman was not going to die because of some natural causes.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man in whom a dart entered his face; the plague was solidified and broke out, causing pain here and there, and it looked like these.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I extracted the dart from the king's princes which had entered his right nostril; it had already fallen off to the right a little, and the whole of the dart was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to heal him from within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then I removed the plague of the dart with a sharp attempt; and then I inquired about it with careful intention, and did not feel it; but then he felt a pain at his right ear, and then I knew that that pain was from the end of the dart.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I applied ointment to the spot with an astringent and digestive power, confirming it to myself that the spot would stop the spread of the plague, and heal it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And nothing bad happened in that spot, which was significant because the dart had entered that place; and I continued to apply ointment there for several days and nothing bad happened; but the plague was consolidated at the same time, and it broke out of its cavity by space for five days, until one day he felt pain on his nose, and he told me: "I feel a pain here."
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then I applied to the plague an acute corrosive medicine for several days and then I cut off the top part, and then I inquired about it with careful intention, and I found the end of the dart which was sticking to his nose.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And I applied to the plague by means of that acute medicine for several days and then I saw clearly the end of the dart; and it passed to me at my hands in the space of four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And then the plague was amplified, and I had to reach for scissors, and then I removed it with a gentle movement of forceps, according to how those things are done in the end of this chapter, until I extracted it; but then I restored that plague.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors said that the cartilage of the nose was not restored, and I restored it; then the plague was consolidated, and he was healed completely, and no bad thing happened to him because of any cause.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recommend to you the quality of extracting some darts, so that you pause here and there, for those things are not understood by me, for the parts of this art and the definitions of those things are not understood by me, as they are not explained in this book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the master knows little about it, and here he knows what is present, and there he knows what is absent; and he has a new operation and new instruments to remove foreign causes from the art when they occur.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And I say that darts are not released from the members in which they are stuck, but according to two ways: either by attraction of the place in which they are stuck; or by the contrary of the other.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that dart is released by attraction of the place, or it is a dart proceeding from a meat-like place, and is thrown and released outside.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not obey the hour when it happens; then be aware that you will have to wait a few days until you can find the meat which is around it, and that is where its attraction lies, and its egress from it.
