E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And apparently if it is stuck in bone and you do not obey the hour when it happens; then leave it for a few days and repeat the process of attraction and movement every day, and then it will be released.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if you do not obey the hour when it happens over a few days; then be aware that you perforate the course of the dart in that bone from all sides with a sharp tool, until the location is amplified by the dart, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the dart is stuck in the bone of the head and has already penetrated into one of the chambers of the brain, and appears on the surface of the skull; then abstain from extracting the dart, and leave it for a few days, because if the dart pierces the skull, death is prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the dart is not stuck in the bone of the head and has not penetrated into one of the chambers of the brain, but passes inside it; then leave it for a few days, and nothing happens to him because of those accidents; then you will have to remove the dart by attraction from his body.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is stuck and you do not obey the hour of extraction; then administer taravels in the course of the dart as I have said before, and then heal the location until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	If the arrow has already been shot into the body and if it is causing pain, then you should question whether or not you feel it, and if you do, then draw out that same arrow with more sharp instruments which are suitable for drawing out an arrow from the body.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot reach it because of the constriction by the bladder and its length, and there is no bone, nerve or vein there, then you should cut through the flesh until the arrow can be reached easily.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if it is stuck in the ear which is held by the flesh, then you should cut out the flesh entirely and carefully pull it out; and devise how to get it out if it cannot be taken out due to the ear being broken and twisted.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you remove the arrow from any place where it is stuck, then you should use your hand with forceps to completely cut through; and be very careful behind the first cut so that the arrow does not break and so that its removal by you and its extraction are difficult.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot reach it with your hand, then leave it for a few days so that the cuts heal; and then try again because when they have healed, it will be easier to remove.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	If the flow of blood causes you pain, then administer that which we said about cure in the book.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And preserve your virtue of cutting veins or nerves or strings, and administer medicine to you in any way which is possible for the extraction of the arrow; and do so with ease and calmness and patience and caution as well as care and advice.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And let the arrow come out so that the patient is according to the figure according to which the placement of the arrow in it should be according to which it is easier.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	If this is not possible for you, then administer medicine which is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	If the arrows that are shot from one side are pulled from the other side, or if you have already shot some of them from one side to the other through the skin, cut off the tip of the arrow with sharp scissors and then throw it away; because it is easy to remove lightly.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	If it has been stuck in the bone, then you should cut the meat with an instrument according to the opposite direction of the arrow’s placement in the bone, and extract it in that way.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	Otherwise, leave it for a few days, and then try again until it burns.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	If the tip of the arrow is in that place, then you should push it out with your hand.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	If the tip has fallen and you want to administer an impulse, then insert it into the concave part of the patient’s foot, and push it out with your hand.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	If the arrow is concave, then you should push it out with a sharp instrument inserted into that place, because the arrow will come out easily by doing so.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is poisoned, then cut off all of the flesh where it is stuck, if you can reach it, and then clean that place with water which is suitable for cleaning.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow has entered into the foot, or the belly, or the bladder, or the rib, and is close to your hand so that you feel it with your touch, then cut off that part, and if you are able, remove the arrow, and then if the patient feels pain, clean that place with water which is suitable for cleaning; and then cure that part until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	The shape of forceps used to shoot arrows:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Hold the ends of the bow with your fingers, and when you pull back the bow, they will make a sharp noise as they cut through the string.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And of those are made special threads, large, small, and thin, according to the size of the arrow and its flexibility, and according to the width of the opening; and according to the constriction of it.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	The shape of a pointed instrument inserted into this concave end so that it is relieved from the arrow’s placement inside it, and pushed out with a sharp tool.
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	The shape of pushing out from the end with a sharp tool:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	in this way that it is relieved from the arrow’s placement inside it, and pushed out in this way.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of bloodletting by veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins from which the blood is taken for bloodletting are those which are used to take blood, and they are: of which are in the head. The following are the veins which are in the head: two pulsatile veins which are in the ears, called auriculares; two herbs which are in the temples, called temporalibus; and two veins which are in the eyelids of the eyes, called lacrimalibus; and the prepared vein in the middle of the forehead, and the vein that is in the tip of the nose; and two lines which are on the cheekbones, called maxillares; and two veins which are on the lower lip, called labiales inferiores; and two veins which are on the upper lip, called labiales superiores; and these are the veins which are called allic; and two veins which are under the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so .v.; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	If there are veins to be taken for bloodletting in the arms, then they are: five. If one of those veins is a cephalica, then it is not suitable for bloodletting; and the people call it “the vein of the head”, and it is a deep vein, and it is a major vein, and it is composed of a ramification from the basilica, and another ramification from the cephalic; and they name that vein “the great vein of the body”, and the basilica is called “the vessel which is stopped in the chest”, and it is named “the citil” (cital), and those call it “the vein of the belly”; and it rises from the arm, and is placed on the flexor side, and that is the one which is bled; and the saveola, and it is the vein that goes between the auricular and the little head, and it has two branches.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And in the foot and leg there are three veins: one of those is which runs from the back part of the head of the wild animal; and the second one is called a deep vein, and its location is on the flexor side of the leg; and the sciatic vein, and its location is on the back part of the leg; and there are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The healing of the veins which are close to the ears is gentle and quick, and it prevents the occurrence of minor headaches and the spread of bad smells from the head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of the vein to be taken is according to your eye: it is that it should be cut from the top part of the patient's head, and frayed there with a sharp knife until it bleeds; then tie the patient's head tightly in a scarf, so that those veins do not appear close to the ears; and if you feel the pulse of those two veins with your fingers, then draw them out.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then take the knife, and it is that which is inserted, and then you should push it into that place where the vein can be seen, and then pull out that same vein within its cavity, until blood comes out; and if there is a need to cut the skin of the foot or leg, then do so until you feel the pulse of the vein.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then raise your hand up to the vein and the cord above the split, and cut off the vein with a sharp scissors.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And be the length of the incision twice as much or less than this quantity; and make a cut from the sunken part as far as you wish it to go.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then tighten the pulleys and allow that part to be raised which needs to be healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And what has been said at the beginning of this book about incisions and their cauterization is repeated here.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	Of the two veins that supply blood to the foot, one is the ancient and bad one, the other is the true one; also of the eyelids, constant headaches, acute fluid excess flowing into the veins.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of the blood in those limbs depends on whether you take it by force or not: if the pulse of the limb is felt and shown to be strong, then you know the blood is good as described above; but if the pulse is weak, try to find out why it is weak.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And then you raise the vein above the part with your finger, and insert the bloodletting instrument between the two veins; and raise the vein up to its place; and cut that part also in the two veins as you have done in the other limb; and let the blood flow according to your need.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then take off the tourniquet from the patient's thigh; and let go of the pulse for an hour; and put the pulleys on it and tighten them with force, and let that part be raised which needs to be healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And what has been said at the beginning of this book is repeated here: the reminder of that limb and of those limbs, and their incision, and their cauterization.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And therefore the bloodletting from the vein of the forehead is appropriate for the ancient diseases of the face and for emigrant, rigor, and putrid ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of the bloodletting depends on whether you take it by force or not; if the limb is tightened with a tourniquet and the vein appears, then you know the blood is good; but if the pulse cannot be felt, try to find out why. There are two ways for this: either you strangle the patient to prevent the pulse from being felt, or else you cut the vessel that supplies blood to the limb, so that it stops flowing and no pulse can be felt.
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then pause the cut just at the top of the fossori (the vessel) on that vein and strike it with a pen or some other weapon in such a way as to cause bleeding, and let the blood flow according to your need; and then take off the tourniquet from the patient's head, and tighten it with force, so that that part is raised which needs to be healed.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	And some vessels are cut with a blade for bloodletting, however, the bloodletting is not done from the extreme parts as it is done from the other limbs; on the contrary, it is done from the side which is closest and most easily reached; and that part is bloodletting according to the transverse direction, because the bone is close and strong, so the vessel would be cut if bloodletting was done longitudinally.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	Of the two veins that run along the eyelids of the eyes, one runs from the eye to the nose, and the other runs from the eye to the ear; they are used for bloodletting from the eyes, and they are good for the ancient diseases of the face.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And the quality of the bloodletting is that you take it by force with a tourniquet on the limb; and then cut those vessels which are good for bloodletting, and stand over their heads.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And the bloodletting is done in one direction only and a little at a time because in that way there would be no loss of blood; but if the bloodletting is done longitudinally, then the extreme part will break, since it is very strong.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then let the blood flow according to your need; and place those pulleys on it and tighten them for an hour; and then take off the pulleys from that part.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	Of the bloodletting from the nose, one runs to the head in cases of severe fever and sudden headaches; and to the ancient diseases of the face, and especially when they are old-fashioned.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of the bloodletting from the nose is that you take it by force with a tourniquet; and then put your hand on the left side of the patient's nose and cut the bloodletting instrument in such a way as to cause bleeding, and keep it there; for the vein does not appear here, and the pulse begins to flow soon afterwards.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Finish the bloodletting little by little and let the blood flow according to your need; and then tighten it with force for an hour, since that part is restored a little by little.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	Of the two vessels that run along the side of the body, one runs to the leg and starts to form a leper; and the other is the cause of ancient diseases, irregular movements, and bad corrosive ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of the bloodletting from those limbs is that you take it by force with a tourniquet on each leg; and place the doctor over the head of the patient, so that the patient lies on a couch.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	Then cut the vein in one direction with a wide blade, little by little; and let the blood flow according to your need or to any quantity that you wish; and then do the same for the other leg.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	Then take off the tourniquet from each leg and tighten it with a little bit of force so that the limb is not suffocated; and let it rest in its place because the disease is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	Of the bloodletting from the veins that run along the body, one runs to the mouth and is responsible for small pimples and pustules in the mouth, and bad ulcers and cracks; and it causes bad ulcers on the nose and the rest of the face.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of the bloodletting from those limbs is that you cut the patient' s nose in front of you, and then tighten it with a tourniquet on the right side of the nose; and move the upper lip to the left and look at the two veins which are on each side, one under the lower lip and another on the other side; and observe how black they are; and then cut one of them by means of an incision.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	Then if you are in doubt, leave it to me; I will cut the one that is most prominent, and that which shows a pus like substance.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And then make the incision of the two veins on the sides of the lips.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	Also, cut and incise both veins that run along the sides of the mouth.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	Of the two veins that run along the side of the tongue, one runs to the head and is appropriate for pre-focaciosa diseases that occur in the throat; it is also good for diseases of the uvula, and for those of the mouth.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	And the quality of bloodletting from those limbs is that you take it between your fingers in front of the sun; and then raise the patient' s tongue; and look at the veins on either side; and observe how their color changes to blacker; and so see which one needs to be bloodletting.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	Then cut each one; and remember that you should not take it by force with a tourniquet on those limbs, because they are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your veins that are bloodletting in the neck are those from which blood runs in all men; and the bloodletting of them is done in two ways, either by means of a blade that cuts with force, or by applying a hot stone; and then cut the vein with a knife, and then see if it bleeds. This is the way to do it.
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this method is appropriate for cutting and of those special veins and the subtlest ones according to the width of the veins and according to their constriction.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Method of bloodletting with a blade:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	then bring the leg up again to its original position, and place a bandage around it tightly;
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	and this is the method of making an incision in order to drain the fluid:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	and this type of phlebotomy is of small depth and has a fine end, so it is suitable for phlebotomy of small veins that contain small blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	may the improvement of phlebotomy of the basilic vein, which is one of three veins: because it removes the blood from the legs that are left with a hole in the groin and from there that goes to the feet and belly.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And let the phlebotomist be careful when performing that phlebotomy, because it leaves an artery behind and if he makes a mistake and pricks during the phlebotomy, he will cut that artery, which will cause blood to flow, so that one should not perform phlebotomy with a sharp instrument.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilic vein does not appear clearly, then you should let it flow and move to another place, or look for a small vein; or perform phlebotomy at the end of the arm, because that is clear; and dry it out with cautery after phlebotomy.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	May you want to perform phlebotomy on the arm, then let's look for the stricture of the arm that touches the place where you know the place of the wrists, and bring it close to your hand; and bring the arm down and dry out the vein with a sharp instrument as mentioned before; and be careful not to cut into the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you stretch it with force, inflate the place that you have stretched with your hand; then that inflation is an inflation of the artery and so it bursts.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if the blood flows during phlebotomy like a child's scream, the blood is thin; then you should know that it is the blood of the artery; and let' stop the bleeding by moving it away from that place for a long time; and if the blood stops flowing, strengthen the arm and leave it.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And keep the patient away from humidity of the foot, and be careful with him and do not harm him for a few days until it is healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	May if the blood does not stop flowing, and you do not have medicine for it, then cut the artery, because its end is contracted, and the blood stops flowing; or take a piece of a fig, and press it on, and stretch that end with your hand and a powder within another day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And if the blood has stopped flowing, then it is fine; and if not, then heal that place with water from which the blood is drawn, in order to remember the place of the powder that stops the flow of blood.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the stopping of the flow of blood is difficult in small places of the foot and due to the contraction of the limb of the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	may phlebotomy of the black vein is beneficial that removes the blood from the cerebrum and leaves the body; because it is composed of veins of the head and of the basilic vein, as mentioned before.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And let the phlebotomist be careful in performing phlebotomy of it, because it leaves behind a nerve; and if he pricks during phlebotomy and injures that nerve, it will cause stupor, and its recovery is difficult and it may not heal completely; and this nerve appears with the feeling; and if it is hidden from some people and is thin and does not show itself, then let the phlebotomist stop phlebotomy at that place where he made an incision to drain blood, and avoid injury of the nerve with your hand.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then you will cut it in length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The improvement of phlebotomy of the cerebral vein is that it removes the blood from the head and prevents the hernia of the neck.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And in this way, if you want to perform phlebotomy by puncturing with a sharp instrument or with pressure, because it is the safest of all veins; because it does not leave behind any artery or nerve.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	However, it is necessary for you to perform phlebotomy that you do not puncture the top of the foot too much, and look for the place that is less sensitive, and do not cut it with a sharp instrument at first; because if you do so, you will damage it with pressure.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	However, it is difficult to stop blood from flowing in some people, when phlebotomy is not performed at first; but this cannot be predicted beforehand.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	may the quality of phlebotomy of that vein and its complications are considered in their correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first one is that it is done in the conservation of health and with the hope of healing; and to perform phlebotomy at the beginning of spring, during spring, autumn, and at the beginning of winter, when there are signs of congestion.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And it is performed phlebotomy on the third day or as soon as possible after three hours have passed from the previous one.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	May phlebotomy that is administered, but when it causes discomfort and necessity, or at noon or at night, always at the same time and continuously.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And that is not phlebotomized before the age of twelve years, and women are not phlebotomized after the age of seventy; those who have already reached the age of sixty are not to be phlebotomized.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And if someone wants to be phlebotomized in any way, let' discuss the budels before phlebotomy with a leon; because in them there may be a retained wound that disturbs the veins, and so they do not draw blood from the main members.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And do not phlebotomize patients who are sick and have a fever or an infection; nor those who drink alcohol excessively, or who are constipated, or who are weak due to fasting or long hours of work, or for any reason that causes loss of blood, or in the body, or animals.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And consider in subtle ways before phlebotomy if the blood is thick, due to diet and drinks; and because of medicine, if that is possible with it.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And enter into the bath if any cause does not prohibit it, or exercise for any reason so that the blood becomes thin.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And pause phlebotomy of the foot at the beginning of the day, which is around three o'clock in the afternoon; and this is the time when the blood is thinnest.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And remember that the foot of the patient in this day is to be avoided from any accidents with animals, such as anger, fear, and all other physical accidents, such as work and unnecessary eating and sleeping.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And on the same day, it is to be present in the use of perfumes and odors that are common among men; and of balsams and other things according to the amount of possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And follow the phlebotomist on a cushion that is softer or that of the patient himself who should be phlebotomized.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And then the patient's arm is extended and rubbed by the phlebotomist twice or three times; and then the limb is tightened with a belt, and wrapped up twice.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	Here is the translation of the text:
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And then tighten it, so that whoever is to be bled should wipe their armpits together before the veins are inflame and evident to the touch.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And then the bleeder should wet their blade with a little oil especially for this; and place their left hand on that vein where they intend to bleed, leaving the spot where they will perform the bleeding slightly exposed so that the blood flows out a little, and the sound stops when the veins are clamped because those are the ones that cause pain when squeezed with force; and it is discovered by the bleeder; and if the bleeding does not stop, then the bleeder should lift their blade.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And so, for all these reasons, the bleeder must be firm and attentive in all these cases.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And then stop the bleeding, especially if the vein is found in a visible place, otherwise, go to another area a little bit away from that spot or above the knee cap, if the spot is not visible.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the spot is inflamed or the patient shudders, then leave it for a day or two, and do not tighten the ligature, because it will attract more swelling, nor go into the bath.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And then perform the bleeding again if necessary.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the vision is small and the pain is subtle, and you fear that the amount you want will not be achieved, then go back to bleeding at that spot again according to the second right angle and adjust a little bit in the vision, and do so with haste before the spot becomes inflamed because this spot is inflamed in many people.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if that has already become inflamed, then do not perform the bleeding again because there is no excuse for you to do so; and place your hand on any part of the foot, because it refreshes the body.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And it is better in this place than oil and other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And apparently administer oil in all the bleeding with which you bleed the veins that should be prohibited from being clamped by the cord of a saint, and make water from tar and sage when paused from one of those on that spot, because the saint softens and twists when it is thick.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if in the spot of the bleeding there is a large swelling, because visible places occur, and mainly at that spot which does not bleed but that visible place, or in the vision of a vein a little bit, and then you cut, and pause over that spot sponge soaked in water and salt, slightly burned, and tighten it for an hour, because it dissolves.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And when water is made from the blood of a saint from that vein in a supplement or from another vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if it remains in that place for a few days any blackness or greenness, there is no water; and if you want to, pause over that spot of olive oil and rosewater dissolved, or of myrrh or calament or something similar to it.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And because visible places occur so that swellings and bumps occur which require bleeding from the basilica.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And so place your hand over that spot, and if it becomes soft and swollen, then tighten the compression on that spot, and then that eminence is evil and bad; and then remember to pause over that spot of water which we have mentioned, because a strong flow will come from the saint's artery.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then use oil to stiffen it, so that the spot remains hard, and then treat it with other treatment before it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And when you extract from the saint all the amount of his virtue, and according to the victorious color on the saint above it.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	Because if the saint is black, then leave it to run until it is light; and if you make it thick, then leave it to run until it is slim; and if it is hot, then leave it to run until its sharpness diminishes.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	And if that is full and strong and has a need for saint's extraction in a visible place, then the bleeding from the vein should be increased and the bleeding performed.
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And if that is sweet, then do its opposite, and when you extract it in two visible places, then make the second right angle tight.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best thing to be administered in a vein bleeding is that it is cut transversely, not punctured.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	And this way of bleeding is saving from saint' flow and nerve injury, and it is more praiseworthy and saving than bleeding according to its length and depth.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And to which is accustomed to happen faints, then perform the bleeding before it with a little bit of water infused in milk of magnesia or simple oxymel burned; and extract the blood from him in three visible places or four.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if it is cold and dull, then drink before the bleeding with a little water infused in myrrh oil or in scented honey, and if it is stale, then drink with a little spice-flavored water, and with other aromatic flavors.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if faints occur due to bleeding, and it is caused by the saint' blood flowing out, then drink water of meat and a little aromatic water; and use spices, and control his feet with that hand.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other causes which we have mentioned in the division of faints for evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And who wants to try his arms and dissolve his saint according to the second visible place, and the saint' virtue is sweet, which dissolves the saint little by little, then it should be done every day.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	But who wants to try his arms, and escape from his saint according to the second night, and his body is strong, then perform the bleeding after seven or nine hours from the first bleeding.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	But who wants to throw the saint out of his body in the opposite way from the starting place, then do it on the second or third day.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	But that body in which there is already a lot of saint' blood and it is hot and causes fever, then leave the saint' blood in one visible place and increase the vision before faints, more than if you had preserved all the conditions of bleeding; and to put your hand on your opponent's wrist as the saint' heart beats, so that he does not die of faints instead of a saint.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And it is not when you want to try your arm and escape the saint according to the second visible place, because it is already closed the vein opening and it is difficult to extract the blood from the saint, then squeeze under it with force and stretch it a little, because water is too bad.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	While you leave it to bleed a second time; or hold water to the sharpness of the bleeding that coagulates the blood from the saint' opening; or place over it tar and sage, and tighten with a little compression so that the saint' blood comes out.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is inflamed, then leave it alone and do not touch it until the inflammation goes away.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if necessity forces you to evacuate the second time, and there is no excuse for it, then draw blood from that spot or in another vein on another arm.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And the vein called “bracelet of the arm” is flebotomized in place of the forearm or of the bicep, when not dilated or hidden, since it is composed of those.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of the bloodletting on him is that the patient puts his hand in water until the vein appears clearly.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	Then tighten it lightly with a strap around the limb at half-way length; then draw blood according to the small transverse line, not the longitudinal one.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	Then make an opening wide and draw blood from that vein at the base of the thumb, a little bit.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood stops, then put your hand in water until you achieve your need.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	May you be if you are in the days of summer, then you are forgiven for not putting your hand in water, and the time is set aside for the body to rest in water's tail during winter.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the bloodletting from this vein is more effective than that of any other vein, since there are no pulsating veins or nerves.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the bloodletting from the right wrist is associated with the health of the person's liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of the bloodletting on him is that you tighten the wrist lightly or your own hand, since you have put it in water's tail, until the vein appears clearly; then draw blood according to the transverse line; and if you cut that vein from one side to another, then do not do so, for it will not be seen.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And preserve your hand from bloodletting, since there are nerves that denude the flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	Then put your hand in water' tail again and let the blood run into that vein, since if you do not, the blood will clot at the vein' end, and the flow will stop.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when you draw blood according to the amount of need, then put your hand over the vein of oil and salt so that it is not hardened completely; and seemingly cover it all with a cloth.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	May the improvement of bloodletting from the left wrist is that it is associated with the health of the person' own body.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	Then do likewise for him in return.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the improvement of the vein is good for the health of those who are about to give birth, just as it is good for the mother' health; and for the retention of menstruation, and the health of the breasts and feet, and their similar appearance.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the quality of the bloodletting on him is that the patient puts his hand in water' tail and draws blood over that spot until it clearly appears; then place your hand over the joint of the wrist; and the location of the vein cut apparent from the palm, and from that branch it goes down to the foot' sole, being ramified into many branches.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And therefore draw blood from a wide limb or the other leg first, since it is better and more effective to cut it early.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you draw blood from the sole of the foot, then guard yourself from the nerves that run under that spot on the sole of the foot; and stop your bloodletting at the transverse line, as if you were to cut it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And be careful with the bloodletting.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	May you not cause pain to the patient; then put your hand in water' tail and let the blood run into that spot until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the bloodletting is done incorrectly in the first attempt, then repeat it a little bit, since the location is good; and do not fear for it to be harmful, but guard yourself from the nerves as we have said before.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	Then do likewise for the other side.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And of the sciatic vein, the location we have described is good at the end of the back.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the improvement of bloodletting on him is that he has pain in his hips when it is done according to the right method.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of the bloodletting on him is that the patient goes into a bath of oil, and quickly tightens his belt from the waist with four threads in a long and slender cloth, since it does not appear except by water.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	Then when it appears, draw blood according to a circle and do so quickly, since it is better to cut it; or cut it from one side to another, as the location is good.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is used for men who are mild and well-behaved; and if you hear blood running, but it does not appear to the touch, then draw blood from a limb, and that which appears on the tip of the finger is good.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And guard yourself from the nerves, and let the blood run according to the amount you want.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then return the strapping and tighten it at the location of the bloodletting, since gently tightening it is good for healing.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of ventilation and of the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Of wind: either from the ear, or from the nose, or from the mouth.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And of ventilation: either by scraping and extracting blood, or byventilating while scraping.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventilation is done in two ways: either with fire, or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the places of ventilation administered by scraping and extracting blood are twelve in number, of which one is located behind the head, and is the last to be cut; another at the back of the neck, just above the jaw; a second on either cheek; two for the ears; one behind the ear, located on the nape of the neck; and two on the shoulders.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And ventilation does not extract blood from small veins in the flesh, nor does it cause harm by scraping it, as is done for bloodletting; nor does it cause harm to a person' health when it is done according to the right method, but it is good for one' health if the ventilation is performed correctly.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	May you not cause harm to the patient by ventilation or in any case, and give it at the beginning of the meal and at the end; and do so at your convenience in time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	And the reason for this is that blood is multiplied in those men who have pain in their heads and faces due to ventilation and they suffer from headaches; and in those whose heads are heavy and gloomy, and whose faces are pale; and in those whose sleep multiplies, and those who sweat while sleeping, and those who have a strange taste in the mouth, and those whose speech is unclear; and in those men who suffer from pain in their throats.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	Then when it is needed in any of those cases, and especially if it is at the third or half-day meal, then order ventilation to be done rather than to wait until the day passes.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the improvement of ventilation at the nape is that it gives gravity to the head and makes it fall into the throat, but not all blood comes out from the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this incision is in the place of phlebotomy of the cephalic.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	It is not necessary that he uses oil that is used for kneading, or in which there is a cold, because it causes great damage.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And by water do not cover those who use the old ones, and on the heads of those who are injured with frost.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	More also that over that is continuing on it is done oblivion; and by water do you command the bellows to pause its hand a little at the wind from the feet, fearing the generation of oblivion.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	More also vinegar is in the place of phlebotomy of the dark vein and of the bazal: and by water confer to cough, and to the contraction of air and to the cutting of the instrument of air, and to sneezing, and to swelling.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And if the vinegar is cooled a little, because if it is paused from below, it generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And the vinegar of acetic acid confer to accidental pains in the head and to blindness, and to migration and to fever, and to pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is in the place of phlebotomy of the bazal.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And if you command the bellows not to press its hand for bloodletting so that it does not pierce the artery and cause a flow of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And if the wind is blown from below to the mouth, it confers to drunkenness in the mouth and to corruption of the gums, and to resemblance to the diseases that are in the mouth, and they stand in the place of phlebotomy of another that is in the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	More also the wind that is made on the two spatulas confers to catarrh, which is done by the repletion of quality.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the wind from the two inner parts of the mouth confers youth by phlebotomy of three veins, since it is of the bazal, fuscal and cephalic vein; because that one attracts all those veins that are clamped together that are in the flesh, and those veins are thinner than the other veins within so that attraction comes to the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the bellows not to process in bloodletting, since the place is naked of flesh, and leave it without nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a wind that is blown on the legs and confers to hemorrhoids of the buttocks and to ulcers from below.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And if you command the bellows that it is a great wind, and that it is of fine air, since the place does not give a strong section; and strong also its hand in bloodletting for bloodletting.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	More also of small legs with great care, since they attract the blood of all the body, and confer to old pains of the lungs and of the mother, and of the bladder; and they cause menstruation, and confer to bothor and ademil; and they stand in the place of phlebotomy of two sophons, and of a linchpin, and of two nails.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, it does not weaken all the body and causes syncope in men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And of the wind of a linchpin, youth is given to youth by the wind of two legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the winds is that you pause the wind at the beginning to see and pour out through the opening quickly, and do not prolong the position of the winds; let them be put away carefully, and that the humors come to the place by adventitious means.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease repeatedly this water and continue within so that you see the place already reddening and swelling and that the rigor of the blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you bloodletting and repeat the water little by little, and approach carefully to the disposition of the bodies.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Since that man who is of tender meat of pigs can be bloodletting once and no more, so that the place is not ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the bellows to increase bloodletting a little bit, and bring the water easily.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thick, then you bloodletting two times, since in the first bloodletting the way of subtleization to the blood and its liquidity is opened.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	More also in the second to the acquired scrutinization of the gross extraction of the blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is much feeble, then do not make bloodletting the third time so that you obtain the last.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	Finally, when we want to extract little blood or a little bit, it is enough to us a bloodletting.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract one blood, let us do a heavy bloodletting; and if we know that the blood is thick, then you bloodletting heavily.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of bloodletting in which the depth of the gouge is only.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if that man whose flesh is thick, rough, dark, and the pores are narrow, so that the places of the winds are soft, open, resolute; if it is in summer time, then also with oil of aloe or oil of violet, or oil of wild roses, or oil of chamomile, or of blood, and to those that seem similar. And if it is in wintertime, then let it be oil of hay, or of hyssop, or of sage, and of mustard.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity is thick, green, then let the oil be amaranth oil, or oil of balsamita, or oil of aloe, or oil of anet, and to their resemblances.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	More also if the bellows is of large size, then it is forbidden to use oil, and that in these places of the wind of their advantage, the ventilation should be done with hot water or very cold water, or water of hay, or water of hyssop, and to those resemblances.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And that man whose blood is of a moist nature, wash his winds with vine or water of mirtr and sumach, and to those resemblances.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And that man whose superfluities are thick, wash his winds with wine of the old, or water of sansuc (which is marjoram), or infusion of anet, or of chamomile, and to their resemblances.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.
