Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	Of the restoration of a fracture when it has been restored, and then cover it with a cloth lightly, according to its natural nature.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a bone fracture has been restored, and then cover it with a cloth lightly, unless: because of many causes of the bandage and of the ligature of it being not done properly; or because of strictness of the bandages too much so that nutrition is prohibited from reaching the member; or because of many useless treatments; or because of excessive movement at the wrong time; or because of a lack of rest for the body and of overcoming it.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And the cure of it is to feed the patient and make his heart tender, so that the pain increases in him, and administer a bath; and insert a thermometer and relief on it.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And then place a cloth on the member, so that the cloth brings the nutrition to it, or continue the treatment of it with warm water, so that nutrition flows and returns to its natural figure.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Of the cure of broken bones that are restored with twists and prohibits their operation from what is covered on them.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When the member has been restored to its nature of twists and bumps on the broken bone and complaint, and it is due to the shape of the member, but also the member does not prohibit its natural operation, then do not receive the word from that one that this member is a new twist.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	But there are many bad medicine and restorative methods that have caused it on our land; and this operation is very dangerous and brings great danger to the signet of which is fatal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	But if the claudication and complaint are recent, then they are encrusted with warm water in which there are tender herbs, as well as leaves of mint and raisin of it, and is made with a liquid emollient, as well as with diallium well-cooked; or that it be a mucilage of mint leaves and is applied with a gray of gin or with an oil of caraway, and is plastered on it; or that they are grass figures and are trussed with threads of cologne, and similar to those of the medicines that are called firm consolidations.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And sometimes it is dissolved with frequent light friction that it is most humid, and is administered movement of the member from beginning to end at all times.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	Might such a twistedness already be added from behind and so done strongly, and it turns into danger and makes the need for surgery, unless that pus above is removed and the continuation of the bone is dissolved, and where excesses of the nodulation of that member are cut out with small incisors, and easily administered to that which is sollicited and studied.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter .xxiii.
De sermo en dislocacio.	Of speech in dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is entirely of some of the joints of the limb, by which it is prevented from moving, and the figure of the member is changed, and great pains come to the malady and injuries.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when a dislocation occurs, unless it is immediately reduced, that reduction being delayed, the joint becomes swollen and stiff, and to reduce the dislocation is difficult.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And therefore it is not convenient that it be heated or stretched in the hour of the application, because it gives rise to spasm and pains ledent.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when it occurs, unless you are prepared for the flebotomy of the limb, and then let the pus be taken away from it; and then the member is dipped in hot water and oil, and then reduced with ease.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And every member is cured with the water in which the memory will come back to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	You have already seen and ordered the chapters on dislocation according to which the bone is broken; from the upper part of the body to the lower.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter.xxiiii.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Of treatment of dislocation of the jaw of the patient's lower jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	So dislocated the two jaws if not treated; and the dislocation of both is done in one of two ways: either they are removed from their place by little movement, and so softened a little; or they are dislocated completely and completely, until they are softened at the joint of departure, so that saliva does not run from the patient' mouth, and his tongue is wrapped up in its own tongue.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But when the dislocation of it is a little one, then in most cases it returns to itself by itself because of little cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is whole and complete, then it is convenient that reduction be administered to it gently, and not be delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the minister has the head of the patient, and enters into it the food of one of his sides in the root of the dislocation of the jaw inside the mouth if the dislocation is of that side; or he enters with both sides of his food, if the dislocation is of both parts, and the other sides are outside those which he engages; and he orders the patient to cease his jaws and execute those movements from any part; and he enguals the jaw and fixes it until it returns to its place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction of it is difficult, and more so if both jaws are completely dislocated, then administer evaporation with hot water and oil, so that the reduction of both is gentle, and do not delay the reduction of both at all, for thus have we said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And then, when they have returned and are closed, and the mouth of the patient is not softened, then pause on those dusts of cloth with wax, and be made of wax and oil rose; and then be bound with ease with soft threads.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on his two sides, and his head be between two pillows, so that he does not lick it to the right or left; and do not pass for force him to eat anything; let his food be a kind of meat, so that when the pains are increased and the jaws are no longer able to move, then let him lick what he wants.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this is to be administered with ease, and not work on the opening of the mouth of the patient towards eating and drinking and calling, so that the jaw is closed and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of two jaws is difficult when they are dislocated at any time and do not return to their places, then sudden fevers and sodas occur, and the abdomen of the patient is very sore, and very much vomits pure bile.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see it, then know that it is a loss; and sudden death occurs to the one on whom it comes within ten days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter.xxv.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	Of reduction of the dislocation of the fork and the end of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The fork is not dislocated from its place by its continuity to the feet; and some are dislocated at the edge of it, and this is declared by feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the restoration of it is that the patient throws himself on his two sides and widens his arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	Then cut the place with your own hand with a firm grip, for it will return to you.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	Then pause on that plaster and dust, and make it strong.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the end of that which seizes and continues to it is never dislocated in any day; then reduce it and bind it up according to what we have said and according to your own equipment.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	Then pause on that plaster, and dust, and tighten it, and order the patient to adhere calmly and to rest until he is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And in this treatment the end of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter.xxvi.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	Of the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated except according to three ways; and the one is that it is dislocated at the edge of the jaw at the edge of the lower jaw.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated at the edge of its own muscle, and this one is difficult; and it is not dislocated at the back of the shoulder, nor at the front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And most often it is dislocated and goes out at the edge of the jaw behind, and in those in which the muscles are few, it is gently dislocated; but in those in which the muscles are many, it goes out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And suddenly a great pain occurs in some people by a hit or a blow, and the muscle of it is broken from its breach, and is recognized by water that has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Then you should not hope for it to return until it has recovered from its pain, and then proceed with its treatment.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And it is very difficult to dislocate it when it is at the edge of the jaw behind; but so you can distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the other, for you mistake between them; and you feel the concavity of the muscle at the edge of the jaw, and the touch of the ear of the patient, and cannot reduce his own head to its place, neither can he turn it towards every side.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated, then feel the foot or the leg of the patient, and do not be afraid to touch him; and do not turn your head away from you.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And from this dislocation is done a little reduction when it is cold and the patient is child.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the minister raises the hand of the patient to its edge; and then stops the ties behind the jaw of the patient, and raises the joint with strength to its place, and the minister raises the hand of the patient, and widens it above; and then stops those ties because they return gently.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	If however by the water which we have mentioned does not return, and from the beginning of the dislocation, days pass, how much the patient is bathed in cold water and is given broths that soften it and make it less painful, with the same reason as if he had been stung by bees, and fenugrec and melilot are added to the water, and it is administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	Then the patient is raised on his back and the head is turned so that it looks up, and the doctor raises his hand over the spine, and then lowers the leg with the foot that hurts, and another servant holds the other leg, so that the patient does not move. And another servant should hold the head so as not to move it, for it returns to its place again quickly.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you want, reduce it in this way: and that there be presented a man who is taller than the patient, standing on one side of him, and intrudes his hand under the patient's foot and raises it up to the hip at the same time the patient is suspended in the air, and another servant should pull the patient's foot away from the hip.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	If however the patient is in pain, then he must be raised up and it should be seen that this pain does not come from another cause, because the dislocation quickly returns again.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced with another way: and that a long pole be fixed on the ground, round in shape, made of mortier, which is not thick nor thin, and is placed next to the patient; since it is put on the head of the pole there are placed lions' skins, and the patient is standing according to the length of the pole, and another hand is extended from his other side with force, because the joint returns quickly to its place.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult to reduce him in any way that we have mentioned, then use this treatment: and that you take a long pole, the length of which is two brasses, and its width four fingers, and its thickness is reduced at the tip according to the shape:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And place on top of the round pole a lion's skin, so that the pole does not slip under the patient' head.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And then the head of the patient is placed on the lion' skin, and the hand or arm is extended over the pole at the other end, and the tip of the pole is held between the assistant's body and the arm.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Then the arm is placed on a step according to its width, and the hand is extended from one side, and the other body part is suspended from the other side, because the joint returns quickly.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the instrument is complete according to each way that is possible for you, and then, waiting for a moment, suspend a rope of wool over the patient' shoulder; and then pour a paste made of flour and egg white over the muscle, so that it is rolled up again, and then tighten the rope around the shoulder with a knot; and let the member roll over the paste, and the hand should be tied to the patient's neck, and it should not be moved for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And since the patient' food is suspended little by little, until the member is comfortable, because it is less painful to the healing process of it.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	Then the food should be given in greater quantity every day and exercise made with it; and if it is not softened, then it is healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	If the joint is dislocated by moisture that happens to it or by some other cause, then three kinds of cauterization should be administered according to what has been said in the chapter about cauterization.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	If even then it does not heal and seven days have passed, you should know that the nerves of it, which are at the head of the muscle, have already split or become stretched or softened; and you should also know that the joint will never again be in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	From the dislocation of that part which is done, the reduction is made with a sudden movement and with force until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then another stricture should be administered to that part, and care should be taken for it to heal.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if it happens that the healing is slow in the member and the movement of it is delayed, then the patient should bathe in cold water so that the gravity in it is removed and it returns to its natural state quickly.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	Of Treatment of Dislocated Shoulder.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	Know that the shoulder joint is dislocated with great difficulty and seems to return with great difficulty; and it is dislocated at all parts, mainly at the front part towards the back, and the dislocation of it is not hidden from you when you see it, because the joint is bent and cannot bend the arm or touch its muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And since you treat the shoulder, reduce the dislocation as quickly as possible so that it comes with a cold sweat; because if it comes with a cold sweat, the reduction is difficult and it does not heal completely; and more so when it is at the back parts, because it is worse than all the other types of dislocation, and more painful, and certain death awaits it.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it, when it is possible to reduce it, is that the patient' hand should be extended with two arms, and the patient' arms should be spread out, and the sides of the body should be placed on the shoulder and let go, and push the joint with the palms of the hands together or with a finger so that it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	If the dislocation is at the front part, then return it in this way so that it doubles its hand with its own hand, before touching it with the palm of the hand.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey to reduction, then administer violent stretching and do it strongly.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And that two ministers extend their arms, and hold the patient' arms in such a way that they are not moved again by the stretching.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	Then the arms should be rolled up again from all parts, because it is wrapped in a long folded cloth over the patient' hand, or limb.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint with his own hand, he should grease it with some oil so that it helps in lubrication of the joint with ease; and then push the joint with a sudden movement until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	Then the reduction of it is done when it is placed on a paste in which salt is made and egg white, and it is tightened with a string around it, and the arm is hung from the neck, and left alone for some days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	Then let it heal; and when the joint has healed in its place, then cut the member off from that part.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	If you see that the joint is not strong, then repeat the paste and member, and leave it alone for some days until it is healed; and then cut it off.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	If it happens that the healing of the joint is slow in its reduction, and the movement of it is difficult, then administer a bath with cold water and gentle friction, and pressure, until it is relieved; or place it on a resting position, so that it does not move; and then bandage it, and leave it alone for some time.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	E approva osta aquellà, et metaquell en banh; et quan suza, lahora tu fregua la junctura am fricació temperada, et approva itera super aquell' aleliati, sò è ronchal de motu, una vegjada, et secunda, et terzà a.,
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	The corruption has already come about in the water for bathing, so it is limited.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you want, pause over that cow's wound wet and scarred with the knife and stretch over it; and make it several cuts, for that is wet and reduce to its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter .xxviii.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Of cure for dislocated shoulders, if they are from the joint that is between the arm and the breast.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	Malassen of the breast some veils are displaced, and the reduction of dislocation is slight, and the opposite is for other joints, however it is necessary to make a reduction quickly in the hour in which they have been displaced, before the loc is pustular or has occurred pustula on it caut.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of dislocation is that you pause the joint of the breast on a table and the minister extends the breast of him, and places the navel or the palm over the vicinity of the joint, and presses it in so that it returns to its location.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However it is necessary to consider if the palm has already been shown on the belly of the breast, then the patient pause the two of his hand on a table as well the extension and the reduction; and if the dislocation is precedent they are the two of the hand, then is the position of the breast' hand intricately on the table, so that the navel of the joint is covered.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And then if he returns soon enough, it is good; and if not, then stretch that with a cloth giving way to the pustula and leave him; and do not repeat it again, because otherwise, he does not suffer nor can it be cured after the reduction has been made.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	However the joint is according to its tortuosity; and there is no cause for the patient, but his hand is softened and cannot be stretched by any means; then know that nerves are thin or twisted, and then it is not necessary to stretch them with a sharp instrument at their place and firmly gives them a push there.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then if the malassen has returned, then pause over it the cloth which we have re-used, and leave it and stretch it by hand for three days; and then untie it and exercise the breast.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if its motion is slow and occurs in it any gravity, then make him stretch that with a tail of water and some cuts, so that he is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of cure for dislocation from the shoulder.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some cuts are dislocated the shoulders at all.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any of these shoulders is displaced from the two of the hand or the belly of him, then stretch that and press the displacement of it with a towel in your hand, so that it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	Then support the tip of the shoulder, and suspend that above the part to which it has been displaced, and leave that for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	Then support that and stretch it in so that he is stretched out by day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when he is not sore the next day, then stretch that again according to its narration, and do not cease to untie that during the day and to exercise its motion, and stretch that at night; and make it for several days so that it is stiff.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do the same for him if it is displaced at the belly of the breast, and stretch that to the part and make the first operation on it, so that he is cured.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And in the same way do for him if it is displaced at any other joint.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Of cure for dislocation of the shoulder's spines.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When it occurs to any of the spines of the shoulder or neck joint, and then two more spines are removed from their places, then there is no cure for him, because death is sought by the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And the sign of it is that the patient's ejaculation is involuntary and cannot be retained, and some cuts are made on some members of him or his two legs or two arms, or one is removed from its place, because then it is cut into four parts; or one spine is removed from its place, for with cuts it is cut.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Then that has been cut is now made into pieces behind and is called gelbozitad.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	However the cure for him is that you consider if it occurs to him from his youthfulness, because then there is no cure or treatment for it at all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	However in that which is caused by a crash or a blow or an analogy to those, the Ancients have spoken at length about the remedies for it, of which some return with great difficulty; also I have seen and improved on it from another which I will tell you, because of my nearness to the matter, my quickness in explaining it, through which I made him understand and he understood.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in the gelbozitad which occurs from the part ahead of the foot, there is no cure or treatment for it; and in the same way for that which has been made into two parts.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And those are not cured except the one which occurs to him at his hand, of which I have re-used again.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And that is that the patient be stretched out on his face over a table higher than his head, and an instrument which does not touch his feet be used in order that it should not be wet.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	Then place a strong stick upright on the ground at the edge of the foot next to the table, and another in the air above the head, and place another stick between his feet in the other hand.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	Then the minister holds one stick, and does not hold it firmly; and the other minister holds the other one according to its form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	Then wrap about the head of the patient and leave the hair-leap free; and extend the edge of the hair to the stick which is intended for the head, and stretch that; then stretch the other hair with your hand to the other end of the foot, and adjust all the hair; and tie those again in the other stick which is intended for the feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	Then the minister drops and stretches the hair to the edge of the stick, and does not hold them firmly in that place; but they are tied again into their places with the stick which is intended for the feet, and the hair is not held thus.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	Then the navel or belly is placed on the spine according to its strength so that it returns, or is placed on a table, and then it is adjusted on the table so that it returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return in this form, then take a table whose height or length is in the air of three brases, and cut into the wall where I have said that it is near to the patient a place where the edge of the table comes in.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	Then pause the tail of the table on the spine and the navel or belly is placed on the other end, and stretch it in so that the spine is cut and it returns to its location.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want, open the tail which is rolled up with the hand; and it is that you stand on the ground and place the head of the patient in the back of two sticks, whose length is a palm, and make it in any stick go across the ground and come back, and place one so that he does not move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And let one turner hold a round stick on which the thistle is turned, and let it be twisted in both ends of the two sticks.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of it is a loop in which the thistle is formed, and its length is a palm more than that one is twisted; and there are similar loops in the other two sticks.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	Then tighten the ties that you have stretched on the patient's feet in the loop in which it is necessary to place the cap of the foot, and the ties that you have stretched on the patient's thighs in the turn that it is necessary to place on their legs.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then each loop should be turned by a minister with his hand, and the doctor crushes the spine according to what we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	This is the form of the turn:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And then when the spine has returned, and the place is closed, it is necessary to apply a poultice of dried blood on an album of milk, and then cover it with cotton; and then place it over the poultice of dried blood on a table whose length is six inches or more than that, and its width the quantity which covers the site of the pain, and over the split of the spine so.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	Then tie it with a tie that we have said, and use the patient' nutrition of subtle substances before it is healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there is any imminence in the site at the end of the healing, it is necessary to administer medicines that soften and cool by means of the administration of the table for a long time, which we have recommended; and already is administered in that place lead-plaster.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And in some cases there is imminent danger to the latter of the two spines of the back, and it is due to that dislocation; and it is that bone which we have already said you should not touch, for it will make you commit a mistake in this medicine, because it would cause great pain.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	You should know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscle do not cause anything other than dislocation only, and it does not happen in those places that happen in the other joints due to small movement and curvature.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the hip is dislocated according to four ways, because it is dislocated in the insides, or in the outsides, or in the front, or behind.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And most often it is dislocated in the inside parts, and rarely in the front or behind parts.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of the dislocation of it in the inside parts is that when you adjust the back of the patient on its back, it is longer and the heel is closer than from the healing, and the patient cannot bend his head because of the loop; and this site is where the loop comes out with a bang.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of that in which you have a dislocation is to those parts that are opposite to this accident; because the accidents of it are opposite to that.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of that in which you have a dislocation is when it expands its own back according to complement, but on the other hand does not bend so much that it hurts him from behind, and if he walks he cannot stand on his feet; and his urine is repressed and his body is aching, and his walking is difficult over the floor.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of that in which you have a dislocation is when it does not expand the back, and he cannot bend his head behind him because he bends his back; and the back is shorter than that one, and the body is aching, and this site is where the loop comes out.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But the reduction of these spices of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, which has already come out with its own medicine; and it does not happen in this cure of everything; and it is not necessary to make a mistake in this case.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But in that case, where the dislocation is recent and is one of the four kinds of dislocations, then you should turn the joint and extend it in both directions, to the right and to the left, because it returns very easily and does not require any other treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this way, then you should prepare a minister very strong and extend the back of the patient from its outside, or to his sides, or with a tie that is tied on the back of it; and another minister should stretch out the hand of the patient above his feet, so that his hands touch his toes; and another minister should tighten the tie on the root of the leg, and another should hold the foot.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And it is extended from him or from the inside to the joint of the rib, or from the back to the split of the hip bone; and the other minister should hold the foot.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And all these extensions are made in one way, so that the patient's body is raised on its back with his feet on the floor and his legs hanging down.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	This kind of extension is particularly good for all four kinds of dislocations.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And if the dislocation returns in that water that we have said, it is good; and otherwise, then all kinds of water are necessary for this cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of itself when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is in the inside parts, then the patient should be placed on its back; and then pause the ties on the root of the leg, and extend the tie in front of the split of the rib to the outside part of the hip bone.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And another minister should hold the arms of the patient, and open the large site of the patient' back and extend it in front by violent extension because that returns to its own place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this kind is the most light treatment for which this member is reduced, compared with other spices.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if it is not done in this way, then the two feet of the patient should be tied together with a strong tie, gently, on both legs and on both heels.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And the length of each should be four fingers, and the back of the patient should be extended more than the other by two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And the patient' back should be suspended from the top of the pole, and it should be at its maximum; and the length of the patient should be two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And then order a young man who is strong to hold the head of the patient, and he should be suspended from the other side by another young man, and the other young man should bend the neck of the patient with a firm chain because the joint returns quickly to its own place.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the self-reduction, when it is dislocated at the outside, then the patient should be placed on its side according to what we have said previously; and the tie should be tightened on the back of the patient specifically, and on its feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And two poles should be put down, one under the feet of the patient and the other on top; and three fists should hold the pole to which the patient is tied, so that it does not get wet by water spilling over from the patient' body, because the extension to the outside parts should not be made by pulling the pole.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And then any minister should extend in his side, and the doctor should put his hand on it and adjust the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Then, if you obey backwards, madame will be much larger; and otherwise, pause over that carefully and thus as we have said in the gourd by that constriction.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	May serve that the patient lies on his side quietly.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in front, then serve that the bed be slightly extended, and according to this narrative place over the buttock; and the doctor places his right palm on the patient's lower back, and approaches the other palm, and extends it over the lower part of the leg at the hip joint.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is at the back of the leg, then do not serve that the patient be extended to his legs, and raise him off the ground; keeping him on a hard surface, so that with a stretch he is separated from the two limbs, as we have said above in the stretching of the foot over two stretches; and it is on its face, and the joints are extended, as we have said, there is no harm.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And serve that be administered pressure to the joint with a table at the place where it is in pain.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Then, when the reduction is completed in the manner described above - and the sign of the reduction of his leg is not hidden from you, that you extend two legs from the patient, and when you see them separated as much as possible, then know that the second limb has returned - and then you adjust two cushions and place a mattress, and stretch the foot in such a way that the thigh does not hurt; and attach the leg to rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	Then return the limb and the mattress, and compare one leg with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Then, if you see those stretches in a vestment, then know that the dislocation has already been fixed, and let the patient go home.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then return and stretch it again according to your first stretch, and let that leg rest for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Then return it, and cause it to walk slowly on two feet or four, until it is comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter II.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of treatment of dislocation of the hip joint.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The hip joint is dislocated according to three ways, because it is dislocated at the front, and at the back, and at the sides more than at the front; and it is not dislocated in front.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation is that you command the patient to place his leg on the cushion; then know that the hip joint is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all these ways is that you pass under the patient's leg, and then that he extend his leg if he can over it; attach the two thighs to his face, and place his foot between the two thighs on his back; and then serve to attach his hip joint to your palms, and stretch those between the two thighs on his back with strength, and another minister extends his foot until the hip returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of recovery is that his leg should touch the cushion with a light, non-laborious movement.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then return it and stretch it again against the cushion, and attach those to a piece of cloth for three days or four, then remove them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not use the patient for walking for some days, until he is healed and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	You may serve to administer strong stretching to the joints in advance of the reduction that we have said above in the treatment of the foot.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter III.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of the treatment of dislocation of the thigh joint.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The thigh sometimes becomes painful with a little movement, and sometimes it is dislocated according to the second intention, and the dislocation of it happens either at the back or at the front.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation is that he feels his thigh swelling in the direction of the dislocation.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	The treatment of movement is that it should be a gentle and easy extension and should be stretched until it hurts, then return it to its place.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	In the treatment of him when it is dislocated according to the second intention, serve to make a patient lie on his side, and have one strong and capable minister at his hip joint, and another behind him in his place.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	Then come to you with the right hand on the top of the patient' foot, and with the left hand at the bottom of the foot in the place of the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	Then throw the foot to you with the right hand, and stretch it with the left arm for two times, and then support it on the right arm as it extends.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	Then serve that he make two stretches according to what we have said.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Then support the foot on the third stretch, and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Then if he returns in one or two stretches according to this method, and if the foot is stretched again, then do so, because that one returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	You may serve to reduce the patient on his back with water that we have recommended, then stretch one leg over two feet on the ground, and support a cushion under it, and wrap a cloth around the patient' foot, so that he does not slip.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	Then the minister of the patient places his cushions, and another minister extends his foot against extension from his hip joint or leg that rests on the neck of the foot; then extend that leg against the extension of its own limb, and the cushion under it, so that the knee does not hurt; and the other minister serves to support the patient' foot with a cushion, and the cushion is placed between the legs of the patient.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	Then the doctor swallows the dislocation with his hand, and another minister places the cushion between the patient' thighs, because the dislocation returns easily.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	Then, when the dislocation returns and is declared to you the health of the reduction, then return to stretching and stretch it with force, and attach the leg to the limb with a strong bond.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	Then you must be careful of the nerves that run behind the thigh joint, so that the limb does not hurt when it is stretched.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	Then leave that leg for two or three days; and if the limb is softened, then stretch it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	Then return that leg in the third day or in the fourth, and do not allow the patient to walk for ten days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	You may serve to walk ahead of that space if it is safe that the dislocation is not over him dissolved and corrupted, and do not take treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if you serve him in the preparation of his food as we have said above in the treatment and preparation, then do not serve to him until he is healed and strengthened.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter IV.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of treatment of dislocation of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Then that which is dislocated should be stretched a little bit before reducing it; and if this is not difficult, do so gradually.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	You may serve to make a patient lie on his side or on a table at the place where the dislocation is, and let him walk as if he were going.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	Then place the patient on his feet, and pause his foot over that which causes pain, then support it with a foot under him as if he were walking; and let him walk gradually until he is healed, and see that he is not in difficulty in walking.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And place the feet of the patient on a table that takes up all the length of the leg, which has two heads, and tighten it strongly and firmly for three days; then remove it and make him rest from walking for four days, until he is well and his recovery is ensured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter .xxxv.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the dislocations that are caused by a splint or by a fracture or by some joint disease.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When this happens because of some cause and you engage in the treatment of that and in the restoration of it, then watch out for success or failure.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And do not imagine that because you are skilled in the art, you can be proud and impatient or arrogant; and that you use only mild medicines to ease the pain a little, and leave the patient to divine judgment, but hope for salvation from destruction, relief from suffering, and some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	Then try very hard to restore it at the beginning of the cause, before the patient develops a gouty attack.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And if the member returns quickly as you wish, then administer the medicine that eases the pain a little and treats the plague by applying cold water to it.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is a fracture and you find the bones separated, then you should set them in place, and do so on the patient who has had simple gout before, in places where those with gout are commonly found.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And be careful and avoid according to your ability that of the instrument in the pathways of danger as it is preceded by my prediction; for you are better off serving your Lord, and remaining permanently devoted to his glory, and more salutary for his true creatures at the right time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the words of Al-Bucaisi, clearly explaining what God wants.
Amen.	Amen.
